Even though we have been working August and September, because SAVI project need to be finished and MetLife need to keep the team.

We expect to received something from them next week because Ana is OOO up to next Monday.
We expect our proposal will be acceptable to MetLife and then we can adjust the addenda and formalize the work already done and for the rest of the year sa well.

Risk Description:
Context: This project supports 3 apps (wmA, SmartApp, MRPS/AH) in fixed capacity with headcounts for entire year 2017. 
Condition: The team will work on projects as per the DM sheets discussed and approved by Met Managers. Generally the trend has been that forecast is available for 3-4 months at the most with sudden ramp-ups or ramp-down requests from clients. There is always a chance that there might sudden team changes: either additional resource requirements if there are more projects or release resources if there are not sufficient projects. 
Consequences: In case there is a ramp-down, team will loose skilled resources who have been working in the team for long time. In the event of ramp-ups, there might be challenges getting wmA knowledgeable resources from market at short notice of 1-2 months.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: Keep a few lower designation standing buffers in the team as backups for sudden ramp-up plans. For ramp-down request, release resources with least application knowledge
Contingency Plan Description: If there are sudden ramp-ups, make the existing buffers as billable and take MF resources and train them.

Risk Description:

Consequence: Delivery Dates not being met
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams

Work closely with GW by creating a service ticket as and when a COTS issue is identified. Plan to adhere  to delivery timelines by –
-	Giving a temporary workaround
-	Giving a partial delivery with known list of scenarios till GW provides a solution

Risk Description: For a key functional, POS1313, we find that lots of production issues and missing requirements are being forced to be implemented as bug fixes.  We have highlighted the risk to customers regarding the same, as doing bug fix will not give sufficient time to perform impact analysis and testing.  However, we are forced to continue on the same due to client pressure.  There are atleast 7 such cases where we have provided quick bug fixes, with client consensus.  The risk here is that there could be hidden functionalities not identified that can be impacted by these changes, that could fail in production once the code goes live.  Clients can question Cognizant's delivery quality at that point, though they are pressuring us to proceed now.
Mitigation Plan Description: We are doing our best to cover as much analysis within the given bug fix SLA closure of 1 day.  We also highlight the risks of taking this approach via email and over phone each time the customers make this request.
Contingency Plan Description: The only contingency that can be done in this case is to fix the defects, if any, when reported.

Risk Name: Scope changes Continuing to come in
Risk Description:
Context : This is a Fixed Bid project with TCV of $10 Mn. Scope of this project - Rebranding Changes for NewCo / RemainCo as Metlife wanted to separate the Retail entity from the existing business for operational and process reasons. There are 90 + applications where these changes need to be incorporated like logo, addresses, users and forms. Total 11 LOBs are there. There are multiple technologies involved such as .Net , Mainframe , Java, Documerge. In-house Scan tool was developed and leveraged in this project to identify the impacted modules . This risk is for Tier1 LOB , having 40 applications in scope . 

Condition :Scope changes Continuing to come in. Extension in build phases foreseen due to some.

(2)Any further incoming CR will be taken up post review./approval of WSLT only.

(2)If risks observed in e2e test plan, assessing possibility for day 2 implementation.

Risk Description:
Context:
Requirement scope varies for each sprint based on business priorities. Due to this, it is very challenging for the team to plan for their work and deliverables.

Condition:
After sprint planning few stories are introduced to a sprint based on business priority and the team is forced to do analysis. Lot of adhoc requirements and CR's are pushed into Sprint.

Consequence:
Results in Delivery slippages as team is unable to do proper planning. We have informed customer about the potential slippages in delivery due to this
Mitigation Plan Description: Customer is proactively updated about the potential slippages in delivery due to scope change.
Contingency Plan Description: ADHOC requirements are business prioritized before inducting in to the sprint with approvals from Clients on the impacts due to the scope change

Risk Description:
Context:
Requirement scope varies for each sprint based on business priorities.

Condition:
After sprint planning few stories are introduced to a sprint based on business priority and the team is forced to do analysis.

Consequence:
Results in Delivery slippages

Mitigation:
Requirements review meeting is conducted and all stakeholders are updated on the impacts due to scope change. The tasks are re prioritized, if they can be accommodated in the current scope" based on the business critical.
Mitigation Plan Description: Requirements review meeting is conducted and all stakeholders are updated on the impacts due to scope change. The tasks are reprioritized, if they can be accommodated in the current scope" based on the business criticality.
Contingency Plan Description: Update on the impacts due to scope variation to various stakeholders. Work with all stakeholders to address the root cause and reduce or avoid the scope changes in future

Risk Description:
Context:

Consequence:

Contingency Plan Description: Client stakeholders are updated on the unavailability of metrics data and update cognizant teams upfront in case of any quality or delivery or any other application issues

Risk Description:

Condition
PALS team should make sure the PALS online region is UP while receiving this MQ data

Consequences
In case if the PALS region is down due to batch delay or some other reason, then PALS team will not receive the input and there may be a chance of missing those data in PALS
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Team has been instructed to monitor batch closely and make sure the real time is UP on time. Proper notification should sent to downstream team in case of any delay
Contingency Plan Description: New DL will be created including the ETL team and the DL will be copied in daily PALS real time checkout mails

Risk Description:
Context: KCC bankruptcy project has started from May 2015. The SOW addendum expired on Dec 2016. 
Condition: SOW is not available from Jan 2017
Consequence: It might lead to Revenue leakage.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
Barclays is moving towards DevTest which means that their expectation from Cognizant will be to provide DevTest  resources for new engagements and more importantly enable existing resources with DevTest skills. 
This could become a major problem because Java developers have no inclination towards learning testing or automation skills. We foresee it as  a hurdle in cross training.
If Devtest becomes mandatory in 2017 or becomes a parameter of our engagement with Barclay, we will have a major skill gap. This will either impact our reputation as Barclays' partner in their Agile/Devops journey or may let to gradual reduction in overall business we do with Barclays or both.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: Plan is to encourage development resources to participate in cross training sessions on testing or selenium.  Resources will be given orientation sessions on Devtest, thus highlighting benefits for them in their individual career paths.
Contingency Plan Description: Mandatory mass enablement of resources through internal/external experts.
Cost Benefit Analysis Decision:
We will keep a watch on  customer's urgency towards building DevTest team, we believe that it will be in a staggered manner and not a big bang approach.  In case the probability of risk realization increases and the result of  mitigation plan is below satisfactory, contingency plan will be activated. Though as a drawback we could see increased attrition levels.

Expected Risk Cost -61200 =30 *102*20
Expected cost of Mitigation - 6500=102*2*30
Cost Benefit Analysis Description:
There is no additional cost associated with it if the required training are imparted internally.  There could be a loss of revenue due to resources attending training instead of working on projects.
To start with there will be about 30 resources needed to be DevTest enabled. Considering 2 days of training per associate expected revenue loss will be approx GBP 6500.  
Possibility that customer will let go of existing resources without providing a formal notification or grace period for mandatory enablement is less but if that happens, it will impact overall billing potential.

Risk Description: This is T&M AD Project. Project team is working on Agile. Primary technology is Java, hibernate, spring. However, We need to hire 20 resources before Q1-2017 but due to hiring freeze in place we are not able to move ahead with recruitment activities and  rolling out offers. This could have a serious impact on the deliverables and release plans outlined for 2017. This will result in Severe delays on delivery roadmap for 2017, business may not get what have been promised.. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Inadequate staffing / Delay in resource onboarding. This will inturn lead to Customer dissatisfaction.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: We plan to start weekday drives by next week, this  way we will be able to select the candidates while the freeze is on, offer roll-out can happen once the freeze is lifted. We will also continue searching for suitable internal profiles.
Cost Benefit Analysis Decision: There is no additional cost attached to it with the current mitigation plan.

Work with the OPERATIONS to bump the priority on the critical JOBs that are waiting for resources.

Risk Description: Frequent and daily build and timeout issues in Dev 1 Environment is causing productivity loss. There is a risk that this will impact the stories committed for the subsequent iterations and also the May release plan for completing planned features.

Project Name: LBG ADM OPER Payment BAM FP
Risk Description:
Context:-pBAM is the third party product to develop the business and technical dashboard, team comprise of 1 onshore and 4 offshore who work on the enhancement of existing dashboard as per projects requirement, currently transition to wipro has started as part of strategic LBG transition
Condition:-During transition it was observed that the wipro team does not have AXAWAY product knowledge which is required to 
get the KT
Consequences:->In the absence of basic tool knowledge cognizant team wont be able to conduct the effective KT to the Wipro team there by resulting into Wipro team not to signed off the KT phase
C2-Subproject: LBG ADM OPER Payment BAM FP (182789)
Mitigation Plan Description: Risk is raised with the client DSM, as part of mitigation Wipro is agreed to start AXWAY training parallel to the KT
Contingency Plan Description: CTS to explain them basic AXWAY tool

Risk Description:
Context-->Project is the combination of ACI GW product where test support,Programme management, enhancement to AMD and test support to ALS/AMD/RLS and BACS projects covered under the same work order. Team  supports the regression testing, system testing for the new payment gateway product UPP from ACI worldwide, they don't have technical insight on what is there in the black box, team receives the product update from ACI and they deploy the same to the respective environment, what team is aware is the functionality of the payment gateway product but no technical expertise due to blackbox.
Condition-->As team is not aware of the real customization took place inside the product they won't be able to support any technical issues in case raised during the different phases of the testing and will not be in position to resolve any sev1/2 or 3 technical issue raised by the QA team, team has to get in touch with the product Vendor to get the issue resolved
Consequences--->Defect turnaround time will increase as there is a vendor process to raise the case with third party ACI worldwide and it may lead to increase the turnaround time of fixes of the defect, as resolution is dependent on the vendor
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Bank has agreed certain SLA with the third party vendor to respond to the cases raised by the cts during testing phase
Contingency Plan Description: As part of contingency bank has requested vendor to provide dedicated resources to work with cts during critical test phases

Risk Description:
Customer is migrating their legacy policy administration system to HUON. Cognizant scope is limited to Data Migration. Team has developed tools for porting data from source to target system and currently in Integration Testing phase.
Customers are doing the Target system customization and implementation, Data mapping, Data transformation of ACMO schema layout. Since Data mapping is in progress chances of rework is happening.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Customers are working on the Target system implementation, Data mapping & Data transformation activities. Since its still in progress, we are getting some re-work. We have also raised this in our weekly status report and have alerted them.
Contingency Plan Description: Customer is aware of this and they are ready to provide us timeline and budget incase if we have to do rework. Moreover its a staff aug project and we keep meeting the expectations on the daily basis. We also share the risks, issues & clarifications in the weekly status report. Project is owned by customers, it is being run in Agile mode. As and when tasks are getting added sprints will be added.

However, Teletrack items and AIS-BK items and few other items have dependencies from other vendor in getting to completion.Also BRD not frozen for few items and changes are received on them frequently.
Consequence:The current roadblocks on the vendor dependencies and changes in requirements if not handled immediately would lead to miss in the timelines and would have critical impacts for the customer as they are related to the regulations/compliance.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: Context: Migration of policies from ASV7 to IPAS is being done by the Development team as per a planned schedule. It is found that the incident inflow for the support team is showing an increasing trend whenever there is a new set of policies migrated to IPAS. E.g. 100% increase in incident volume in September compared to August 2016.Risk: However, there is no proactive addition of resources that is planned. Impact:This might lead to difficulty in meeting SLA commitments. For instance, P2 resolution SLA for October and November stands at 81%, which is below the target of 95%.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: Currently the number of resources are planned based upon the AS7 prod support resources. So if there will be any policy migration from AS7 to AS10 then current team will be capable to work on the incidents. Need to revisit the plan before migration of other policy admin system. It might be possible that we will rotate resources between development and run state team to reduce the transition timeline.
Contingency Plan Description:
Currently the number of resources are planned based upon the AS7 prod support resources. So if there will be any policy migration from AS7 to AS10 then current team will be capable to work on the incidents. Need to revisit the plan before migration of other policy admin system. It might be possible that we will rotate resources between development and run state team to reduce the transition timeline.
On boarding resources from migrated policy admin system or from build team, if required.

Condition: Application methodology has been changed to Agile, and the estimates are client focused. This poses a risk in the timeliness of the deliverables, as the resources are not yet scaled up, to perform independently.

Consequence: The resources has to be in constant guidance and the extra tasks be split up among other resources to meet the timeliness of the deliverables.
Mitigation Plan Description: The resources has to be in constant guidance and the extra tasks be split up among other resources to meet the timeliness of the deliverables.
Contingency Plan Description: KT for each and every task has to be given before they start any work.

Risk Description: This is T&M AD Project. Project team is working on Enhancement. Primary technology is IntelliMatchm, TLM, CTC, Informetica, SQL. However, Aggressive Release plan / timeline. This will in turn lead to Additional rework.
Mitigation Plan Description:

Risk Description:

Condition: There are around 13 components impacted for this migration which includes complex and very complex components for code changes. Project team has completed the code change and delivered to SIT team (Cognizant testing team) by 9th Mar’17 without doing unit testing for the code changes. 
Consequence: Absence of Unit testing will lead to inadequate tracking of the testing against the code change which may lead to Requirement/ Request deviation and more number of defects in the higher environment leading to poor code quality.

Risk Description: Life Actuarial is a part of Metlife Corporate Systems. It is involved in supporting and maintaining the applications that are related to Reserve calculations for Group, Traditional and Universal Insurance. We have  4 offshore and 1 onshore associates in  Life Actuarial Oracle team who helps business with study of claims, morbidity/mortality studies and provides periodical financial reports. In total of 5 resources we have only one Powershell skilled resource and the team has dependency on him.  Backup for  the resource is not available currently . Hence the dependencies on this resources are more during critical deliveries

Identifying a resource to get cross-training in Powershell.
Ensure effective training happens so that the resources can handle any Powershell scripting in the project
Contingency Plan Description: Backup resource who can support  in the absence of Powershell resource will be brought in and trained appropriately

Account Name: The Royal Bank of Scotland Group plc
Risk Description: This is T&M Managed Service Project working in Staff Augmentation model. Resources are working on various technologies and at various states. However, resource is not able to continue as per SOW due to any unwarranted reason, there would be risk of losing the position. This will result in Schedule delay and impact on Quality.  Due to this, the project runs the risk of resource unavailability for specified skill matrix. This will in turn lead to Not Meeting on Time delivery and Quality of the work.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: To provide early indication/request to work on the same. Resource needs to complete the mandatory 4 weeks period after indication. In the meantime, replacement can be found.
Contingency Plan Description: To provide early indication/request to work on the same and replace the resource within 4 weeks. Be aware of the skilled sets for all resources and the work they are doing. Keep ourselves informed of the pool to find immediate replacement of the specified skill set.

Non availability of these key check points may lead to breach of logical security/data changes in production environment which may seriously affect the performance of application and may lead to customer dissatisfaction, major outages and breakdown.

Risk Description:
Context: Team provides support for change Management. 4 change requests are combined and tracked in a single change request (Change request # CRQ230324) as per request from client. However only incidents are attached to the main CR. Risk:  But the RCA for the individual CRs are not available and there is no protocol set for the sequencing. With incomplete traceability, team would not be able to map the deliverables against client 's expectations/requirements. 
Impact: Customer Dissatisfaction.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Stability & Adequacy of Technology; Inherited System
Mitigation Plan Description: Protocol needs to be defined such that I90 changes should be logged and tracked by someone from I90 team itself, so that the granular details can be tracked as part of the CR submission process.
Contingency Plan Description: If situation doesn't upgrade, then we have to go along with the existing process, where the mother CR will still be created and maintained by some onshore coordinator from other team. At best we will have to train him on I90 change protocols.

Risk Description: Context: There is not having sufficient work for the entire team, Risk: hence there is a possibility of downsizing of the team Impact: Profitability

Consequence: Absence of internal data analysis and control may lead to breach in critical SLA

Risk Name: SP Estimation not revised in Iteration
Risk Description: Estimation which is committed at the start of the iteration is carried forward and not updated within the iteration. For the scope changed PBIs the estimates has to be revisited.
Mitigation Plan Description: Trained each scrum masters and team to revisit the estimation when there is a requirement change. Also created awareness to enter actual hours in the TFS instead of 6 hrs normally planned to burn every iteration.

Risk Description: Team should be walked through with the TFS Burnt down chart and make them understand the importance of this so that actual hours is properly logged and SP estimation is reflected appropriately
Mitigation Plan Description: Trained each scrum masters to review the burndown chart in the Daily standup. Also updated the team about the importance of the burndown chart and the inference derived if not updated properly.

Risk Description: Team should be walked through with the TFS Burnt down chart and make them understand the importance of this so that actual hours is properly logged and SP estimation is reflected appropriately

The DEV environment is already configured by LPL Infra team, but the but the QA environment which is required to perform the smoke testing and QA testing is not yet configured by the infra team. QA testing is planned to be started from 27th December and Smoke testing should be performed before QA. Any further delay in setting up the QA environment will impact the timelines of the project.

Risk Name: . Training not completed for new resourc
Risk Description:
As part of this migration activity, 29 resources are working in this project, 22 from offshore and 7 from onsite. 
40% of the total associates are junior level resources(Designated as PA and PAT) and they don’t have any previous exposure to migration projects. Role based trainings have been identified for this resources and it’s in progress. With 40% associates not having completed the training the project runs the risk of not meeting the desired product quality and timelines of the project.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: The team structure consists of good mix of senior resources, who mentor the new members from time to time. Besides this application specific details are captured in the form of questionnaire from app owners. This too helps in enhancing the knowledge of the team.
Contingency Plan Description: Lesson learnt documents are maintained and juniors are provided on the job training as soon as they are on-boarded.

Risk Description: This is a migration project where the scope of the project is to migrate LPL Applications from Windows 2003 Platform to windows 2007 platform. There are 30 applications in scope and are planned to be migrated in 4 waves. As per the migration plan all the 4 waves should be completed by July 2017. The initial signed SOW is valid till 31st December 2016.Amendment for the extension of SOW is yet to be approve from Client.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: As per the scope of the March Release the project is involved in a major Enhancement of GPOS application. According to the requirement, the project needs to introduce Inbound EDI 810 files which is not supported for invoices previously . Also for this modification the input data is fetched in the form of 'XML' from a 3rd Party vendor "TEIS" as GPOS itself do not able to parse the XML file itself . Till date "TEIS' team had not provided the original xml structure for further processing. Cognizant offshore team had created own xml for performing the coding and unit testing. The project had planned Unit testing from 26th December and absence of original XML input data lead to leakage of more number of defects in the subsequent testing phases of the project and this could also impact the quality of the deliverable.
Mitigation Plan Description: Risk raised formally in Client portal
Contingency Plan Description: Sample EDI810 message used for Development and testing

Risk Description: The project is working for CUT phase of 'Payment History' enhancement which is in scope of MO2 release.The project is planning to update technical design document after completion of coding for Payment history. Updating design document after coding phase cam lead to risk of rework and affect schedule timeline of the project
Mitigation Plan Description: Design Document is being planned to be documented in parallel with the development. This is not going to pose a risk since the framework is reused and any change after that would require not much changes to be done from coding perspective.
Contingency Plan Description: Design Document is being planned to be documented in parallel with the development. This is not going to pose a risk since the framework is reused and any change after that would require not much changes to be done from coding perspective.

Risk Description:
Clientline reporting application currently used oracle exadata as backend. Everyday we have around 500+ jobs running on this database and we are giving L2 & L3 support on these jobs. It is required that all jobs to be completed before 9AM EST thus making sure availability of data and schedule reports to end users [Merchants]. We have been experiencing oracle exadata database issues with regards to data block corruption , ACFS hang-up and ora-600 oracle internal errors which impacts these jobs to complete successfully.

This may lead to unsuccessful loading of data [partial data load] and delay in job completions which in term affects the availability of data & reports to end users [Merchants]
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Client has planned for oracle patch, schedule on 5th Nov & 13th Nov
Contingency Plan Description: Strict guideline are in place for production support team to proactively monitor the jobs on oracle exadata , and in case of any failure resolved the issue by re-running the job.

Context: Cognizant team has completed Data mapping for PLS but for DRC Scope and requirements are not finalized till date. 
Condition: A 3rd party vendor (Accenture) is responsible for SSIS related work and this delay is from their end. PLS and DRC requirement baseline are now crucial to avoid any rework which can impact the deadlines. 
Consequence: Requirements of DRC are changing till now and it is leading to risk of rework which will in turn impact the overall schedule.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: A draft version is already available to us and according to that the mapping is in progress. Onsite is continuously communicating with client for the final version of DRC XML. It would be available as soon as possible (before 02/27/2017) as per communication with onsite. The final mapping will be starting on 02/27. According to the draft version, we are already one step ahead as similar fields will be reflected in the final version.

Risk Name: Risk due to Delay in ADPART License
Risk Description: Section 3.2 of SOW states the Deliverables description for this project. For Testing, ADPART is required for test Scenario Design for NLG2 – both OIPA & for 12 interface. Cost for 2 license of ADPART for 1 Year is mentioned in SOW. Till date the license agreement is not signed off by business for ADPART. This is pending since 31st October 2016. Delay in receiving sign off for the same means we will not be able to deliver the activity flow from ADPART.
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant Legal team working with NW Legal

Risk Name: Risk of defect leakage and Product quali
Risk Description: Master Query Log is observed during audit in which 108 queries are tracked. 36 queries are not addressed yet. Out of this open queries 2 are Critical, 19 are high, 13 are Medium and 2 are low. Out of these 26 queries are integration related. The team is in advance stage of Coding. Hence these unaddressed queries may lead to high chances of defect leakages in later phase like SIT and UAT which will in turn impact the product quality.
Mitigation Plan Description:
1. Early workshop with Requirements, Config and QA teams.
2. Regular sync-up meeting and follow-up with customers.

Risk Description:
Interface SRD and HLD document completion getting delayed due to multiple reasons, which are not in control of Cognizant, like unavailability of OIPA data-hub (DM Schema) for extract to be sent to downstream applications etc. 

Risk to overall program and schedule for new product launches down the line.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Integration re-planning done internally and discussed at high level with customer. Cross Road document shared with customer, so that they can align the interfaces with the OIPA Drop plan.
Next steps: Conduct workshop with NW and come up with joint action plan.

Consequence: Unavailability of Review comments tracker might lead to reoccurrence of gaps to subsequent phases which would result in huge rework and effort towards analysis/fix etc. This might result in issue leakage and poor Quality of Analysis documents
Mitigation Plan Description: Review tracker prepared
Contingency Plan Description: Set expectation to team and have tracker updated periodically

Risk Name: Risk of Rework and Product Quality
Risk Description: Changes to requirements is a challenge! 1. QA is completed but requirements are still changing and new requirements are coming. Since there is no baselined version of requirements due to requirement change, team used to change the code during QA phase. There is almost 50-60% code customization done. 2. Design Review is completed initially on Baselined BRD. But after change in requirements, design has also been changed frequently. But no review is done on Design document after that. Due to the above 2 scenarios, it is leading to rework and there is a risk of defect leakage in UAT and post production which will impact the product quality.
Mitigation Plan Description: The requirement changes are primarily on ETL side where as we testing the outbounds some new requirements are emerging. Team is incorporating these changes along with the defect fixes that is currently ongoing for the earlier phases.  Will continue to monitor

Risk Description: After QA defect fix, E2E regression testing is not planned. Though the entire interfaces are tested; however the base data for testing remains the same for regression as well. This poses a risk of more defects in UAT, which might impact the product quality as well.
Mitigation Plan Description:
09-March-2017
Currently UAT in progress and the outbounds are being generated on daily basis however there is no report of major degrade even though regression is not done. The outbound will continue to be generated till 31st May 2017 so this risk will need to be monitored till then

Risk Description: Performance testing has not yet started yet and PT timelines yet to be finalized. This has been highlighted to AIU CIO. Mitigation Plan Description: The risks of not doing performance testing have been highlighted to AIU several times. However due to other priorities in the project, this has been getting pushed for future. Some of the components have been performance tested in isolation however end to end performance testing is still pending. Will continue to follow up with the customer.

Risk Description: Application is built upon latest technologies. It is mandatory that Subject Matter Experts(SMEs) are available for each technology in order to address the technical queries raised or issues/challenges faced. If the SMEs are not available at Northern Trust during the period of project implementation, then there will be an impact in quality, timelines and effort.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant technology team working at onsite spent more than 5 years and they are working as SME now on business and technology areas. Continuous update in technical skills by onsite team will make them come good as SMEs in all area. Onsite team is doing that currently.

Risk Description: Requirement changes even after requirements freeze period. It is happened due continuous business changes, Northern Trust might report changes to requirement. If the changes are brought in during design/coding phase, then it will impact the timeline and effort estimated, since there are rework required at analysis/design/coding level.
Mitigation Plan Description: When changes reported by Northern Trust during the design/coding/testing phase, then Cognizant will do a detailed analysis on the area of impact/testing strategies and come up with estimated on effort required and the timelines when it can be delivered, reason on whether it can be accommodated with current release and if not. These will be communicated to all stakeholders. Based on the discussion on clients consent Cognizant will proceed with reschedule/replan /onboard new resources etc and implement the changes and deliver to client.
Contingency Plan Description: Cognizant will establish and follow a robust change management procedure. Cognizant will provide status reports and project plans on a weekly basis highlighting impacts, effort, cost and schedule. Key stakeholders of the Northern Trust team will be made aware of the project schedule and associated dependencies/ requirements. The schedule including key deliverables and milestones will be conveyed well in advance to all Northern Trust stakeholders so that they can plan the delivery..

Risk Name: Delay in receiving response for  queries
Risk Description: Detailed Business requirements are provided by Northern Trust for each release. As part of requirement analysis phase, Cognizant onsite and offshore team will raise queries to client if we are not clear on any of the requirements or if they have missed / assumed some part. It is important that these queries should be clarified by client in a timely manner, since delay in receiving the clarifications will impact timelines for delivery.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Timely resolutions of all the issues raised is important to contain this risk, as the project is going to be executed in planned schedule.
An issue tracking SIR database to log and track issues will be used. Issues will be highlighted in status reports.
Contingency Plan Description:
Timely resolutions of all the issues raised is important to contain this risk, as the project is going to be executed in planned schedule.
An issue tracking SIR database to log and track issues will be used. Issues will be highlighted in status reports.

Risk Description: Source code is not is SCLM production region/PVCS: If current production version source code of mainframe components or PB components provided by Northern Trust is not available in PVCS, and if a change needs to done in those components, then there is chance for functionalities getting missed.
Mitigation Plan Description: Source code for Java are currently maintained in TFS and the stored procedure are maintained in PVCS. Every changes done for the release will be checked-in the repository before going for build. Before moving to any source control repository, NT will take care of earlier codes with the help of Product SMEs.
Contingency Plan Description: A new branch will be created from the production version of last release and the changes corresponding to the current release will be checked-in in the new branch. It mean for every release there will be label or placeholder to retrieve files. With that at any given time we could get the source code version of earlier releases.

Contingency Plan Description: Cognizant will escalate the issue in advance whenever there is need in performing an environment setup activity by Northern Trust. If the environment setup is delayed and if it causes additional cost/effort a change request will be raised for the additional cost/effort expended.

Contingency Plan Description: When a resource is about to exit, KT plan will be prepared with list of components he/she has worked and date will be fixed for each module. A detailed documentation will be done by the resource who is exiting and the reverse KT will also be documented.

CG Dev
Mitigation Plan Description: PMO has started discussions with SG on this. CG has requested for a new environment which has only R4 code, so that defect raised on merged code can be retested in this environment to ensure that this is a CG defect.

Project Name: LBG ADM CATM Dev - T M
Risk Description:
Context - As per the MSA, the project teams will have to showcase year-on-year productivity improvement to customer. For this purpose the productivity base-lining initiative has been undertaken in the LBG projects. Each eligible project is expected to follow an estimation methodology as agreed with the customer (FP/UCP/CP). In case of CP template, the team has to customize the CP estimation template as per their respective projects and get it signed-off by LBG. Thereafter, the team has to perform productivity base-lining using past data, arriving at productivity value, identifying improvement levers and implement the same for showcasing productivity improvement.

Condition - The project team has customized the estimation template and the same has been signed-off by the customer as well. However, the work assigned is not getting sized as per the agreed estimation template / methodology. The actual size is also not getting computed

Consequence - This may result in a delay / miss in implementing the rest of the steps related to showcasing the productivity improvement. It would also lead to breach of contractual commitment and would impact the service credits.
C2-Subproject: LBG ADM CATM Dev - T & M (164146)
Mitigation Plan Description: All the project applications have Estimation sheet approved by the bank which will be used.
Contingency Plan Description: Get the final estimations and productivity approved by the Bank.

However, As per the MSA, the project teams will have to showcase year-on-year productivity improvement to customer. For this purpose the productivity base-lining initiative has been undertaken in the LBG projects. Each eligible project is expected to follow an estimation methodology as agreed with the customer (FP/UCP/CP). In case of CP template, the team has to customize the CP estimation template as per their respective projects and get it signed-off by LBG. Thereafter, the team has to perform productivity base-lining using past data, arriving at productivity value, identifying improvement levers and implement the same for showcasing productivity improvement. The project team has customized the estimation template and the same has been signed-off by the customer as we.. This will result in the work assigned is not getting sized as per the agreed estimation template / methodology. The actual size is also not getting computed. This may result in a delay / miss in implementing the rest of the steps related to showcasing the productivity improvement. It would also lead to breach of contractual commitment and would impact the service credits.. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Under estimation of work content - effort / schedule. This will in turn lead to Low productivity.
Mitigation Plan Description: The team is working on ideas and innovations which will be used for target productivity benefit, there are productivity/value add benefits already passed to Bank for H1 2017.
Contingency Plan Description: Project team to pass on productivity benefit in all the SOWs to meet the targets.

Risk Name: Delayed start of RulEX POC  and assessme
Risk Description:
Context: VOYA LASC Phase II project is all about the requirements gathering for migrating the policies administered in Pacesetter (source application) to IPAS (target application). Requirement gathering will be done based on the premise that current IPAS features and processes need to be leveraged to the maximum. A gap(s) analysis need to be conducted between Pacesetter and IPAS to identify the differences during the assess phase through a collaborative discussion with Voya (source application SME) & IPAS (target application SME).
The assess phase is getting delayed because of unavailability/limited availability of SME from Voya. 

Condition: The pre-requisites to start the assess phase are not resolved yet and those are pending with Voya (source application SME) for a long period.Source code for Ingenium is not available for RulEX tool analysis.

Consequence: This is delaying the assess phase and overall execution of the project (i.e. the requirement gathering for the identified gaps between source & target).Slow down the analysis and requirements of Drop1 in the absence of augmentation and validation through RuleEX.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description:
Approval to move Ingenium code to CMCi (Voya Legal)
Allocation of Actuarial resources and kick off the assessment (John)
Maximize leveraging Operations and IT resources (Aruna)
Throttle Pacesetter and give preference to Ingenium

Risk Description:
Context:  Death Claim transaction needs IT hand –holding and tweaks.
Condition: Inconsistent behaviors in processing the Death Claim transaction.
Consequence: Delay in death claim processing. Claims processing and Cognizant support is on toes to process and disburse the claims for majority of the intake
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description:
Cause of Death, Release Claim processing extremely slow. Coming up with an approach.
Short term:
1. Work with PACE, PT teams on query tunings and poiential issues [completed query tuning for identified queries ; issue identified with queries taking different execution plan than expected]
2. Involve DBAs for simulating issue with Oracle 12c not taking the expected execution plan in perf region and work on a fix (including creating SRs with Oracle if needed)
3. Short term approach agreed is to work on a Plan to disable 'Adaptive Plan ' in prod and manually revise execution plans to take the best for SQL ids with issues

Long term:
redesign death claim with Voya's buy-in.

beond the short-term solution, this will remain an open residual risk till integration with claims vantage

Risk Description:
Context:  Change governance and release management function for the IPAS platform.
Condition : High Build team overhead during the release activity .
Consequence: Inadequacy of controls introducing risk and poor quality.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Continual Service Improvement Beyond the Contract
Mitigation Plan Description:
1) Reviewed findings of COE with the larger team 
2) Augmented the feedback received from Voya 
3) Objectives identified 
4) Prioritizing and building action plan 
5) Process document and using version number - Demo completed, update on documentation pending
6) Release calendar - calendar for 2017 has been shared with Voya and Cognizant Development teams
7) Trace-ability log in the defects in SNOW that will sync with Voya SNOW with eBonding - X_IPAS_BUILD group created to create a consolidated backlog as interim solution.

Date revised to 4/30 to minimize the disruption and time needed to mature and fine tune the process

Team reported there is a tool now to copy OIPA rules between environments that would alleviate some of the pain in the current process

Risk Description:
Context:iOS 9 App Transport Security(ATS) is blocking web services(system) over HTTP protocol.
Condition:We requested to upgrade the servers to support http requests. But this upgrade is taking time as it is a enterprise wide change.
Consequence:Timeline gets affected and results in the delay in the project delivery.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: A Boolean entry on info.plists to support arbitrary loads. This will allow requests over http but for the permanent solution the servers needs to be upgraded to support https requests.

Risk Description: For Sprint 1, 250 code review comments were reported by the customer in which 40% is on the coding standards violations. During the coding phase, customer specific coding standards were not adhered resulting in a huge number of code review comments from the customer end. Not adhering to coding guidelines could lead to code quality issues resulting in customer dissatisfaction.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Conduct joint analysis and discussion sessions with Keylane reviewers to understand their way of working. Classify comments in specific categories and take appropriate action (e.g., for coding stand violations, implement checkstyle validation). Introduce dedicated reviewers in the team who will review subsequent deliverables.
Code review will be done using Code Collaborator tool (owned by Keylane) to maintain review traceability. Configure and implement checkstyle to implement basic coding standards followed by Keylane.

Risk Description: Planned end date for Sprint 1 was Jan 27th 2017. Since team has received high number of review comments from the customer, it is not completed yet. There is already a schedule slippage of 2 weeks for sprint 1.This might have a cascading impact on the upcoming sprints thus impacting the overall project schedule.
Mitigation Plan Description: First, baseline one module in terms of functionality and Keylane's coding approach. Initiate parallel development of other tracks to meet overall project timelines by optimizing resource distribution across tracks.

Risk Name: CS Audit not conducted-El Salvador Fclty
Risk Description:
Context: Cognizant manages back office operations for One Call Care Management (OCCM) from Noida. New deal is signed to increase our scope (444 associates at offshore locations and 115 associates in EL Salvador). The deal consist of 28 different track to be outsourced to cognizant in four different location – NOIDA(200) , Hyderabad (217), Manila (27) and El Salvador (115). Transition will happen in phases. As Per Schedule I - Information Security Addendum – Section 3, Cognizant has to conduct internal security risk assessment consistent with the requirement of ISO 27001 at least annually
Condition: As Per Schedule I - Information Security Addendum – Section 3, Cognizant has to conduct internal security risk assessment consistent with the requirement of ISO 27001 at least annually. Corporate Security Audit had not been conducted till date. The team is able to copy client sensitive information from the Citrix environment to their respective local machines.
Consequence: Due to non-conduct of the Information security audit for El-Salvador location, the facility is at risk of leakage of client specific information which might lead to legal issues.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Account Name: The Prudential Insurance Co. of America
Risk Description: PPA Design team involves in creating Functional/Technical design artifacts for new initiative projects. As a part of creating artifacts the team does a good amount of analysis in understanding current functionality to identify the modification/future state but the understanding of current functionality is not being properly documented in Enterprise Architect as a pattern diagram, due to this whenever a new project arrives in the same functionality area, the team is putting same amount of effort again in understanding current functionality.
Mitigation Plan Description: In order to mitigate the risk, the team is currently documenting the analysis in word document so whoever works on the same functionality in future can go through the existing analysis document which will reduce the repeated effort.
Contingency Plan Description: Team should properly document their analysis in Enterprise Architect as a flow diagram which will be used as a blueprint to understand the current functionality whenever the new project arrives

Risk Description:
Context: DR environment needs to be updated in regular basis.  

Condition: As part of delivery excellence and most importantly for business continuation, all the codes needs to be updated/migrated to DR environment in regular interval. It should be in Sync with Production for any disaster situation to continue the day to day business as smoothly as possible. 

Consequence: There could be in some cases where code can't be migrated to Prod and DR in parallel. Please run any job/ automated script to sync between DR and Prod, otherwise in disaster situation, there will be impact on day to day business.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Stability & Adequacy of Technology; Inherited System
Mitigation Plan Description: In regular interval (twice per month) run any job or automated script to sync prod and DR database. So that in disaster situation business can run without any interruption.

Risk Name: Early alerts for SLA breach absent.
Risk Description:
Context - This is a non-AVMSBU project. The project team consists of 13 resources (7 offshore + 6 onsite). The technologies used in the project are UNIX, Oracle, Mainframe and Java. The team works purely on production support activities such as Incident management, Problem management, Change Management for problem fixes, batch monitoring and user queries in support mailbox. The team supports 7 applications that are related to collection and recovery – SACP, CACS, DM4.1, DM6.2 DMR, DMC and Data Cash. The team has read-only access to the production environment. The latest SOW was evident during the audit and is valid till 30 Jun 2017. The project operates in Fixed Price Outcome based mode. The team fills Clarity time-sheets which are submitted to the client. SLAs and penalties are applicable for the project, but the project has not had any SLA breach in the last 2 months.

Condition – SLAs and penalties are applicable for the project. However, early alert mechanism for possible SLA breaches is not configured in the ticket tracking tool. 

Consequence - Due to absence of the early alert feature in the ticketing tool, this there is a possibility of SLA breaches leading penalty being levied or client escalation.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
Context – The project team supports the One Banking application (Direct Net, EAM NET Home, EAM NET Admin, MD Public, MD Employee, DN Mobile ) for the customer from February 2016. The project team consists of 9 resources (7 offshore + 1 onsite + 1 testing). The technologies used in the project are JAVA and Struts tool. The team majorly works on bug-fixes. The team works on quarterly releases. The team has finished working on the February release and is currently working on the June release. The latest SOW is valid till 30-September-2017 and the project operates in T&M mode. The team receives the bug-fix requests in QC tool. The defects are prioritized in the QC tool after discussion between the onsite and offshore resources and the defects are then assigned to the offshore team. The team has received 75 defects for the June release.  

Condition - Though the team is aware about the defect management process, defect prioritization document is not available with the project team.

Consequence – Absence of the defect prioritization document may result in the defects being incorrectly prioritized which may lead to a delay in resolution of critical defects.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
Context - This is a non-AVMSBU project. The project team consists of 5 resources (4 offshore + 1 onsite) and the technology used in the project is UNIX. The team supports the Temenos products. The Cognizant team works on production support activities and the services offered to the client are incident management, problem management, change management, batch job monitoring and application health checks at SOD. The scope of work for the Cognizant team is to analyze the incident tickets and provide a solution to the Temenos team. The project team has admin access to the PROD environment. If any ticket requires major code or data fix, it is performed out by the Temenos team. The deployment is then done by the Cognizant team. The latest SOW is valid till 31-January-2017 and the project operates in fixed-bid mode. Apart from 1 resource, all the other resources at offshore will be released at the end of December 2016.

Condition - The team performs manual activities such as deployment, data correction in records, data fixes from Temenos (scripts / routines provided by Temenos), housekeeping activities (space, user session deletion, etc.) in the PROD environment. The team receives 2-3 such requests in a month.

Consequence - This poses a business / information security risk in case team members accidentally change data wrongly / delete data in production. This may seriously affect the performance of application and hence lead to customer dissatisfaction, major outages and escalations.
Mitigation Plan Description:
It is agreed and approved with the Client that it is necessary for our Live Support Team to have Live Admin Access.

To ensure we have adequate 'control measures' we have the following process in place:

1.  4-Eye Check in place:  Manual changes/activities done in Live Environment by one of our team members is duly checked and approved by another competent SME from our Team in real time.  This is to avoid/detect any errors real-time.

2.  One-Time Password:  Our team doesn't have 'write' or 'admin' access for Live Environment uninterruptedly.  We only have 'read only' access at normal times.  Whenever there is an 'incident' or a Live Change for which our team needs 'write' access to the Live Environment, then our team has to request for OTP from IT Security Team by quoting the Incident/Change Ref.  IT Security team in turn will check if the requester is an 'authorised admin resource' and validates the purpose (by checking the Incident/Change ref) and then provides the requester with the OTP to access Live.  

So the above two are the control measures as well as the Mitigation Plan to avoid mistakes & errors, and also to prevent any unauthorised use/sabotage of the Live Environment.
Contingency Plan Description:

Whenever there is an 'incident' or a Live Change for which our team needs 'write' access to the Live Environment, then our team has to request for OTP from IT Security Team by quoting the Incident/Change Ref.  IT Security team in turn will check if the requester is an 'authorised admin resource' and validates the purpose (by checking the Incident/Change ref) and then provides the requester with the OTP to access Live.  

So the above two are the control measures as well as the Contingency Plan to avoid mistakes & errors, and also to prevent any unauthorised use/sabotage of the Live Environment.

Risk Description:
Context - This is a non-AVMSBU project. Raymond James is an US based client and team works on Client Reporting Applications. The Financial Advisors uses this portal to create financial reports which will be used by the client. The Cognizant project team works on developing the reports in Jasper. Condition - At the time of service development, sufficient test data and proper parameter values are not provided to the project team by the service team.

Contingency Plan Description: Wii point to QA environment if test data not available in DEV environment.

Contingency Plan Description: To provide early indication/request to work on the same and replace the resource within 4 weeks. Be aware of the skilled sets for all resources and the work they are doing. Keep ourselves informed of the pool to find immediate replacement of the specified skill set.

Account Name: American Express Travel Rltd Svcs Co,Inc
Risk Description:
Context: As part of Amex transformation, there was a ramp down in the project in the month of December and most of the resources got released. Current team size is 5 offshore and 1 onshore. 

Condition: All projects are running in agile mode and there are bi weekly releases in the project and there is no proper forecast for the current resources. 

Consequence:  There is no forecast to the current resources and there are 2 Programmer Analysts in the project who cannot be released. There are chances that entire project might get closed and hence need to look projects for PA's
Mitigation Plan Description: Follow up with onshore counterparts and client to get the forecast and place resource accordingly and in parallel look for projects in other LOB's for all the existing PA's in the project
Contingency Plan Description: Ensure proper forecast is always available by continuous follow up so as to avoid these scenarios

Risk Description:
This is T&M AVM Project. Project team is working on Scrum. Primary technology is Mainframe, Unix, Triple A, Sybase. . However, ST region no available for testing due to 14.06 upgrade testing in progress.. 
This will result in Delay in ET deployment for TA-1994 and TA-2260 RFC. 
Due to this, the project runs the risk of delaying the production implementation of deploying the RFCs TA-1994 and TA-2260. 
This will in turn lead to Not Meeting on Time delivery.

As a mitigation plan we might be doing a virtual verification of changes and avoid any kind of testing in ST, Instead we need to perform additional testing in ET.
Mitigation Plan Description: As a mitigation plan we might be doing a virtual verification of changes and avoid any kind of testing in ST, Instead we need to perform additional testing in ET.
Contingency Plan Description: As a Contingency we will be checking with the upgrade team if ST deployment can be started earlier.

Consequence:  The automation can start only once the UI is available as a complete piece which would be more or less towards the end of Sprint 3 and not before that.
Mitigation Plan Description: The current team is working on to upgrade their skill set to enable them to work on automation for this project.

Risk Description:
Context: Shareholder ID application support has more change requests during the recent days along with regular support tickets. Senior resource with application knowledge has moved to different project and new developer started working on the application.  Also .NET changes will be handled by EOS support person along with EOS tickets.

Condition:  New SSRS developer should take care of the deliverables and learn the system quickly in order to work on the change request.  Also need to cross train one person from EOS team to work on shareholder ID issues .

Consequence: It will impact the response time for deliverables (Change Requests & Regular tickets) in both EOS & Shareholder ID project
Mitigation Plan Description: SSRS developer has to understand the application and gain knowledge about the system. Additional EOS team member should learn .NET piece of the application quickly

Risk Description: This is T&M AD Project. Project team is working on Ongoing product enhancements and fixes. Primary technology is Java Technology. However, It is suggested to use the Delivery Tracker to ensure the team level targets are met and addressed on time. This will result in Missing the delivery targets leads to delay in overall phased releases. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Inadequate Program Management updates & concurrence from client. This will inturn lead to Customer dissatisfaction.
Mitigation Plan Description: Delivery Tracker Identified and followed for Scrum 1 and 2 from Iteration 6.5 onwards. to followup and ensure the delivery dashboards are shared consistently

Risk Description: Yet to get the Design Sign-off  for C12029, 12296 and Gen-5577 from ATLAS BA which might affect the Project schedule
Mitigation Plan Description: Schedule the meeting with ATLAS BA's to get the approval for proposed design as early as possible
Contingency Plan Description: Risk has been highlighted in Status report and its been communicated to Clients.

Risk Name: Nexen URL is not loading GRS page in ERS
Risk Description: GRS application is not getting loaded in ERS when ERS is accessed from NEXEN URL, the issue is with WB team to resolve as there is no handling done by Workbench team for this. It may cause issue when accessing GRS application from NEXN platform and hence may cause a risk for the GRS application users if they have access only to NEXEN platform for accessing reports.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Currently there is no user on boarded in NEXEN for GRS application, hence user can use corporate trust link to access GRS application in ERS instead of using NEXEN platform, workbench team is working on permanent fix which will be available in next scheduled build
Contingency Plan Description: Currently there is no user on boarded in NEXEN for GRS application, hence user can use corporate trust link to access GRS application in ERS instead of using NEXEN platform, workbench team is working on permanent fix which will be available in next scheduled build

Risk Name: Data Dependency with third party data
Risk Description: In ERS Reporting reports are getting generated using third party data, complex calculations are done using OLAP service (interfacing). So if the data is not provided on time, integration process may delay, also during integration testing fir different types of report due to lack of real data all scenarios are not being tested, this may lead to defect prone delivery
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Design of stub code to imitate the third party operations can provide way for integration testing when third party data is not available also setting up third party data with stub code will give more testing coverage to the application for complex calculations.

Risk Description: Cognizant Prod Support Team  has access to production environment. This may lead to critical production data updation by Associate which may lead to escalation.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
Scope of the project is to enhance the Policy admin system ‘Genius’. Currently team is working on  D&O changes where additional coverage needs to be added to D&O product.
Requirement  document “FRD_FP 3787 D&O Product Enhancements V0.1.docx” shared by Customer on 5th Aug 2016 is still not baselined. Development is done based on this requirements specification document only. Any change in requirement might lead to rework in later stages.
Mitigation Plan Description: Requested Client for Finalized BRD for FP 3787. Going forward, Clients will be requested to provide Finalized BRD to commence next step.
Contingency Plan Description: Clients will be requested to provide Finalized BRD to commence next step.

Risk Description:
Scope of the project is to enhance the Policy admin system ‘Genius’. Currently team is working on  D&O changes where additional coverage needs to be added to D&O product.
As per the SOW “4243_001.pfd”, section 5 “Deliverables” , the design document needs to be delivered to customer and has to be signed off by customer. But the design “FP3787 – DO Product Enhancement _ Technical Design V1.0.doc” has not been delivered and sign off. Not sharing the design as per the contractual might lead to contractual concerns and risk of defect leakage/rework.
Mitigation Plan Description: Clients expects only the  BA review and UAT signoff. Could check with clients if design document has to be considered as deliverables or SoW needs to be revisited to remove Design document as Deliverable
Contingency Plan Description: Though Design Document is not an deliverable to client. Internal review is done and signoff to proceed with next phase.

Risk Description: Changes in  JIRA or BRD  are not communicated to QA team at all times as some of the changes are communicated in emails to dev team alone. Owing to this there is a difference in what the QA team is validating for and what was developed by the Dev team. This leads to QA defects that are rejected/reopened multiple times.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description: Development team has been educated to update the clarifications that were received via email in JIRA, so that QA team is also updated. Customer has been educated to update JIRA rather than send things via email.
Contingency Plan Description: QA team has developed a methodology to demonstrate the issue to the dev team to get their feedback and concurrence and also to ensure that both the teams are working on the same requirements.

Risk Description:
List of JIRAs that are to be deployed as part of the release are discussed and base lined. Development team takes more time to build, unit test and assign the JIRA to QA for SIT.
Critical JIRAs are assigned to QA team during last week of production move . This gives lesser time for SIT and hence poses a risk for defects to lead into UAT/Production.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description: Release calendar is base lined well in advance and tickets that are not assigned to QA are highlighted. If they are getting delayed, then the customer is updated and the risk is highlighted and if needed the item is moved to the next release.
Contingency Plan Description: If the item to be tested is very critical and cannot be moved to the next release, we re-prioritize the other Jiras to ensure that free up some bandwidth to ensure complete testing.

Risk Description:
There are 2 modules in this project which has gone live on 10th December. As per contract we have to get a signoff on the automation suite as well. Not getting sign off will amount to non compliance.

The risk is, we are facing difficulty to get sign off on the automation suite due to the following factors:

1) ALM execution is not consistent due to open issues
2) Constant changes in the application impacting the closure

Non compliance will lead to contractual obligations.
Mitigation Plan Description:
1) Work with client automation team to fix the issues

2) Estimate the changes required to update the automation suite to align with the application changes
Contingency Plan Description:
1) Exclude the ALM execution from the current scope closure and take it up for work commitment post closure

2) Exclude the impacted areas with agreement from client

Risk Description:
This risk is for "CBF Indiana Public Retirement System (INPRS) Annuity Implementation"
Context: VRPS is to be enhanced to administrate and maintain the new INPRS contracts.  INPRS participants will be loaded on VRPS under Company 02. A new batch enrollment set up needs to be created to load contracts on to Vantage database on a daily/regular basis. 
Cognizant AD team has completed QA drops for Phase 1 and Phase 2. Currently AD is working on the CRs received and targeting to meet the next QA drops for these. 
Condition: QA drops for Phase 1 and Phase 2 have been completed on 10/7/2016 and 10/21/2016 as planned. Team is currently working on the additional CRs and targeting the next QA drops planned on 1/18/2017 & 2/24/2017. The project deployment date has been postponed to 21st July 2017 from 10th March’2017. QA/UAT has completed a part of testing (Day1 changes) by mid of December 2016 and have put the testing on hold currently. As per latest revisions in the timeline, the testing will resume from March/April. Confirmation of the final timelines are pending.
Consequence: Inability to commit sufficient time for completion of below tasks from the following partner groups, may affect the revised timelines for this project-
1.	Timely sign-offs from VRPS Business partners on the open queries and clarifications for the additional CRs.
2.	Any change in the TPXU file layout at a later point of time, will need rework on the data load validation module and retesting of the entire process. This can significantly impact the timeline.
3.	Delay in the GD1 Accounting change implementation from the GDI interface end will impact the timeline as VRPS will not be able to proceed with the testing.
4.	During the entire QA/UAT Testing execution, mock-up files have been used for loading and validation. So any discrepancy in the mock-up data file and the actual file that will be sent from the vendors in real time during the real time Vendor testing phase, cannot be identified at this phase.
5.	End to end Unit Testing/Integration Testing for VRPS will have to be done in parallel after the QA Drop and any Defects will be fixed by AD during the QA/UAT Testing Phase.
Mitigation Plan Description: AD is closely following up with Business and respective stakeholders and interfaces for the timely approvals and sign-offs.
Contingency Plan Description: If there is a change in the requirement or delay in approvals, the QA/UAT drop date will have to be pushed accordingly.

Risk Description:

Context: VRPS is to be enhanced to administrate and maintain the new INPRS contracts. INPRS participants will be loaded on VRPS under Company 02. A new batch enrollment set up needs to be created to load contracts on to Vantage database on a daily/regular basis.

As per latest revisions in the timeline, the testing will resume from March/April. Confirmation of the final timelines are pending.

Risk Description:

Requirement stability is a concern due to ever changing requirements. This will impact on the quality of deliverable and timeline.

Risk Description: As there is a dependency on UI to complete the integration testing in DEV, EMEA and LATAM UI is unstable as there are issues with file viewing. This dependency is with 3rd party vendor for UI. There is a risk on timely delivery for SIT as the DEV integration testing is not completed
