Risk Description:
Context: GATP is planned to go live on mar-13. Business wants this functionality to be used by May after proper user training during April.
Condition: if there is a delay to delivery and the Go Live date is pushed, this can impact the business roll out after training.
Consequence: If any delay to Go Live will impact the training planned which can impact the actual business rollout
Mitigation Plan Description: Make sure that proper project tracking is done to avoid any schedule slippage and also proactively highlight the impact to customer due to any schedule slippage
Contingency Plan Description: work on any schedule slippage or schedule extension due to CR and update customer without delay on the new go live date and its impact

Risk Description: This is T&M AD Project. Project team is working on Open. Primary technology is Tandem. However, Onboarding of replacement resource takes 8 weeks due to delay in getting RR approval, BG completion, VDI  &Clarity Access.. This will result in 8 weeks of schedule delay. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Absence of adequate staffing plan - Staffing Challenges. This will inturn lead to Low profitability.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: Client team will be requested to expedite the RR approvals, VDI & other access formalities required to be done for onboarding new resources and reduce the existing timeline.
Contingency Plan Description: Client team will be requested to expedite the RR approvals, VDI & other access formalities required to be done for onboarding new resources and reduce the existing timeline.

Risk Description: Source code is not is SCLM production region/PVCS: If current production version source code of .Net components or PB components provided by Northern Trust is not available in PVCS, and if a change needs to done in those components, then there is chance for functionalities getting missed.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Source code are currently maintained in TFS and the stored procedure are maintained in PVCS. Every changes done for the release will be checked-in the repository before going for build. Before moving to any source control repository, NT will take care of earlier codes with the help of Product SMEs.
Contingency Plan Description: A new branch will be created from the production version of last release and the changes corresponding to the current release will be checked-in in the new branch. It mean for every release there will be label or placeholder to retrieve files. With that at any given time we could get the source code version of earlier releases.

Risk Description: Detailed Business requirements are provided by Northern Trust for each release. As part of requirement analysis phase, Cognizant onsite and offshore team will raise queries to client if we are not clear on any of the requirements or if they have missed / assumed some part. It is important that these queries should be clarified by client in a timely manner, since delay in receiving the clarifications will impact timelines for delivery.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description:
Timely resolutions of all the issues raised is important to contain this risk, as the project is going to be executed in planned schedule.
An issue tracking SIR database to log and track issues will be used. Issues will be highlighted in status reports.
Contingency Plan Description:
Timely resolutions of all the issues raised is important to contain this risk, as the project is going to be executed in planned schedule.
An issue tracking SIR database to log and track issues will be used. Issues will be highlighted in status reports.

Risk Description: When a resource is moving out of NT project (due to release/resignation), the current position of the resource getting released should be replaced with another resource, who possess the required skills. The replacement should be done before the current resource gets released from the project, such that there is an overlapping in timeline, where in the required KT about the project/work handled by current resource can be given to the new resource. If this does not happen then there will be an impact in delivery timelines.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: Every resource will share their knowledge of the module at the end of reach release in which they are currently working on and a document will be prepared for future reference. It will avoid dependency with single resource. All resources are aware of the business and requirement. KB articles will be revisited periodically and updated on each release.
Contingency Plan Description: When a resource is about to exit, KT plan will be prepared with list of components he/she has worked and date will be fixed for each module. A detailed documentation will be done by the resource who is exiting and the reverse KT will also be documented.

Risk Description: Application is built upon latest technologies. It is mandatory that Subject Matter Experts(SMEs) are available for each technology in order to address the technical queries raised or issues/challenges faced. If the SMEs are not available at Northern Trust during the period of project implementation, then there will be an impact in quality, timelines and effort.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant technology team working at onsite spent more than 5 years and they are working as SME now on business and technology areas. Continuous update in technical skills by onsite team will make them come good as SMEs in all area. Onsite team is doing that currently.
Contingency Plan Description: Northern Trust is having Architects and SMEs for each technology and they are addressing our queries. Our onsite team is in constant touch with Line managers on NT SMEs. Line Managers is fine with on Cognizant supports to provide SME.

Risk Description: Delays in getting the environment setup: To start with System/UAT Testing, the environments should be available with stable condition before the start date of testing. If the environments are not ready and stable, there will be an impact in defect detections and schedule for starting/completion of the testing.
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant will escalate the issue in advance whenever there is need in performing an environment setup activity by Northern Trust. If the environment setup is delayed and if it causes additional cost/effort a change request will be raised for the additional cost/effort expended.
Contingency Plan Description: Cognizant will escalate the issue in advance whenever there is need in performing an environment setup activity by Northern Trust. If the environment setup is delayed and if it causes additional cost/effort a change request will be raised for the additional cost/effort expended.

Risk Description: Requirement changes even after requirements freeze period. It is happened due continuous business changes, Northern Trust might report changes to requirement. If the changes are brought in during design/coding phase, then it will impact the timeline and effort estimated, since there are rework required at analysis/design/coding level.
Mitigation Plan Description: When changes reported by Northern Trust during the design/coding/testing phase, then Cognizant will do a detailed analysis on the area of impact/testing strategies and come up with estimated on effort required and the timelines when it can be delivered, reason on whether it can be accommodated with current release and if not. These will be communicated to all stakeholders. Based on the discussion on clients consent Cognizant will proceed with reschedule/replan /onboard new resources etc and implement the changes and deliver to client.
Contingency Plan Description: Cognizant will establish and follow a robust change management procedure. Cognizant will provide status reports and project plans on a weekly basis highlighting impacts, effort, cost and schedule. Key stakeholders of the Northern Trust team will be made aware of the project schedule and associated dependencies/ requirements. The schedule including key deliverables and milestones will be conveyed well in advance to all Northern Trust stakeholders so that they can plan the delivery..

Risk Description: Delays in getting the environment setup: To start with System/UAT Testing, the environments should be available with stable condition before the start date of testing. Risk Description: Source code is not is SCLM production region/PVCS: If current production version source code of mainframe components or PB components provided by Northern Trust is not available in PVCS, and if a change needs to done in those components, then there is chance for functionalities getting missed.
Mitigation Plan Description: Source code are currently maintained in TFS and the stored procedure are maintained in PVCS. Every changes done for the release will be checked-in the repository before going for build. Before moving to any source control repository, NT will take care of earlier codes with the help of Product SMEs.
Contingency Plan Description: A new branch will be created from the production version of last release and the changes corresponding to the current release will be checked-in in the new branch. It mean for every release there will be label or placeholder to retrieve files. With that at any given time we could get the source code version of earlier releases.

Risk Description: Requirement changes even after requirements freeze period. It is happened due continuous business changes, Northern Trust might report changes to requirement. If the changes are brought in during design/coding phase, then it will impact the timeline and effort estimated, since there are rework required at analysis/design/coding level.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: Application is built upon latest technologies. It is mandatory that Subject Matter Experts(SMEs) are available for each technology in order to address the technical queries raised or issues/challenges faced. If the SMEs are not available at Northern Trust during the period of project implementation, then there will be an impact in quality, timelines and effort.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: When a resource is moving out of NT project (due to release/resignation), the current position of the resource getting released should be replaced with another resource, who possess the required skills. The replacement should be done before the current resource gets released from the project, such that there is an overlapping in timeline, where in the required KT about the project/work handled by current resource can be given to the new resource. If this does not happen then there will be an impact in delivery timelines.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: Every resource will share their knowledge of the module at the end of reach release in which they are currently working on and a document will be prepared for future reference. It will avoid dependency with single resource. All resources are aware of the business and requirement. KB articles will be revisited periodically and updated on each release.
Contingency Plan Description: When a resource is about to exit, KT plan will be prepared with list of components he/she has worked and date will be fixed for each module. A detailed documentation will be done by the resource who is exiting and the reverse KT will also be documented.

Risk Description: Source code is not is SCLM production region/PVCS: If current production version source code components provided by Northern Trust is not available in PVCS/TFS, and if a change needs to done in those components, then there is chance for functionalities getting missed.
Mitigation Plan Description: Source code for Java are currently maintained in TFS and the stored procedure are maintained in PVCS. Every changes done for the release will be checked-in the repository before going for build. Before moving to any source control repository, NT will take care of earlier codes with the help of Product SMEs.
Contingency Plan Description: A new branch will be created from the production version of last release and the changes corresponding to the current release will be checked-in in the new branch. It mean for every release there will be label or placeholder to retrieve files. With that at any given time we could get the source code version of earlier releases.

Risk Description: Detailed Business requirements are provided by Northern Trust for each release. As part of requirement analysis phase, Cognizant onsite and offshore team will raise queries to client if we are not clear on any of the requirements or if they have missed / assumed some part. It is important that these queries should be clarified by client in a timely manner, since delay in receiving the clarifications will impact timelines for delivery.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Timely resolutions of all the issues raised is important to contain this risk, as the project is going to be executed in planned schedule.
An issue tracking SIR database to log and track issues will be used. Issues will be highlighted in status reports.
Contingency Plan Description:
Timely resolutions of all the issues raised is important to contain this risk, as the project is going to be executed in planned schedule.
An issue tracking SIR database to log and track issues will be used. Issues will be highlighted in status reports.

Risk Description: Delays in getting the environment setup: To start with System/UAT Testing, the environments should be available with stable condition before the start date of testing. If the environments are not ready and stable, there will be an impact in defect detections and schedule for starting/completion of the testing.
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant will escalate the issue in advance whenever there is need in performing an environment setup activity by Northern Trust. If the environment setup is delayed and if it causes additional cost/effort a change request will be raised for the additional cost/effort expended.
Contingency Plan Description: Cognizant will escalate the issue in advance whenever there is need in performing an environment setup activity by Northern Trust. If the environment setup is delayed and if it causes additional cost/effort a change request will be raised for the additional cost/effort expended.

Risk Description: Application is built upon latest technologies. Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant technology team working at onsite spent more than 5 years and they are working as SME now on business and technology areas. Continuous update in technical skills by onsite team will make them come good as SMEs in all area. Onsite team is doing that currently.
Contingency Plan Description: Northern Trust is having Architects and SMEs for each technology and they are addressing our queries. Our onsite team is in constant touch with Line managers on NT SMEs. Line Managers is fine with on Cognizant supports to provide SME.

Risk Description: Requirement changes even after requirements freeze period. It is happened due continuous business changes, Northern Trust might report changes to requirement. If the changes are brought in during design/coding phase, then it will impact the timeline and effort estimated, since there are rework required at analysis/design/coding level.
Mitigation Plan Description: When changes reported by Northern Trust during the design/coding/testing phase, then Cognizant will do a detailed analysis on the area of impact/testing strategies and come up with estimated on effort required and the timelines when it can be delivered, reason on whether it can be accommodated with current release and if not. These will be communicated to all stakeholders. Based on the discussion on clients consent Cognizant will proceed with reschedule/replan /onboard new resources etc and implement the changes and deliver to client.
Contingency Plan Description: Cognizant will establish and follow a robust change management procedure. Cognizant will provide status reports and project plans on a weekly basis highlighting impacts, effort, cost and schedule. Key stakeholders of the Northern Trust team will be made aware of the project schedule and associated dependencies/ requirements. The schedule including key deliverables and milestones will be conveyed well in advance to all Northern Trust stakeholders so that they can plan the delivery..

Risk Name: Sign Now Service Queries not clarified
Risk Description:
Context: External system interaction touch point queries clarification
Condition: If not clarified on time.
Consequences: Schedule slippage of completing the code.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Set up regular call with Sign Now team and clarify the same on time.
Contingency Plan Description: Inform Metlife that if any major deviation in initial plan,  it will impact the timeline and schedule has to be redefined

Risk Name: DOL- risk to quality and timelines
Risk Description:
1. Context --> Project DOL was started to fulfill the US Department of Labor tax market rules. The phase 1 of this project should be deployed in production in April 2017. As per the project plan the signed off BRD should have been obtained by Sep 9 2016 and the requirements analysis for ‘Core FRD’ sign off should be completed by Oct 7.

2. Condition --> Now some of the requirements are ambiguous and we are raising questions regarding them. Business is taking time to respond. So there will be a risk if the requirements are not clear within the timeline. 
 
3. Consequence --> The QA drop may be delayed or more resource needs to be added in the project or the quality will be hampered of code due to  the stringent timelines.
Mitigation Plan Description: The timelines needs to be revised based on the  date on which the FRD would be received.  Follow-up with stakeholders proactively.

Risk Name: Lack of test data in DVSz
Risk Description:
Context : Certain defects are not reproducible on DVSz easily. Sometimes test data is not readily available to test defects in DVSz.

Condition:  Lack of test data in DVSz.

Consequences: Some defects may reopen in production.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: With the help of testing team Testdata in DVSz will be created so that defects can be tested successfully.
Contingency Plan Description: PTA testing should be conducted to avoid breakouts in production.

Risk Description:
Context : Sometimes certain business approvals or clarifications are required for changes/defect fixing. 

Condition:  Delay in response from Business or concerned person and clarification is not done on time. 

Consequences: Some defects may be postponed due to delay in business/IT clarification. Due to pending approval or clarification , further action or changes are not possible .
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Regular follow ups should be done with IT/ business to receive approvals/ clarifications on time.  Required clarifications should be mentioned in WSR.
Contingency Plan Description: If clarification is not received on time, it may lead to delay in delivery of defects. In such cases defects to be postponed to next release.

Risk Name: P8 Migration issues in DIG service in E1
Risk Description:
Context: P8 Migration issues in DIG service in E1 environment due to WAS85 servers migration from WAS8 servers.

Condition: After P85 migration, most DIG service JVM is down down intermitertnly in E1.
Due to this need to depend on PSG team to resolve the issues. We need to raise a PSG issue ticket and need to provide all the required details like server name, JVM name , Error details and environment details to resolve the issues.

Consequences: E2E teams testing got impacting due to this environment issue and  which in turn effects the Time lines of the project.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Given US HUB E1 URL for E2E teams to proceed further
Contingency Plan Description: PSG Team working on this issues

Risk Description:
Context - This is an AVM project operating in T&M mode. Scope of service includes functional enhancements, bug fixing and migration work. There are total 7 offshore resources (non-affiliated) working in the project. This project involves three application which are POETS (profit and loss of APAC region, Polar (portfolio reconciliation system) and GPT (global price testing). Technologies involved in this project are Cybage, unix, pearl, control M and shell.  
Condition QA is also performed by developers. Same set of test cases are executed during unit testing & SIT/QA and same test environment is used. Team doesn’t have any resource from testing horizontal (who specializes in SIT, test case preparation, executing and publishing results).

Mitigation Plan Description: We do not have a dedicated tester and this point has been escalated many times to the higher management in client forums and they are  working on it with their higher management.

Account Name: Association de frais Groupe AXA Belgium
Risk Description: There has been layoffs at AXA side worldwide due to budgeting constraints in Life Lob. At IT side total approx. 60 layoffs are due to happen. AXA has done an assessment of the current collaboration with CTS has highlighted some pain-points. Primarily AXA governance team can be divided into AD, AM and CPE teams. Though the SA and AM managers have given good feedback the COE team has given poor feedback on Code Quality, Unit Testing, Estimation, Collaboration and Ethics areas. The feedback is conflicting in nature with the feedback received from SD/ AM teams. COE team has presented this feedback to the vendor management team. Now ongoing and assessments will continue to happen till AXA organization stabilizes. This poses a risk to Cognizant. Cognizant may get escalations due to lack of confidence of the AXA Coe team.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Delivery team is working closely with the DE team both at onshore and at offshore. Delivery audit calendars have been shared which is in synch with project’s release calendar. Stringent Code quality measures have been already taken up and will be reviewed during the delivery audits prior to each release

Risk Description:
Context : Project Met1310001- A&I-CIS-2016, gets covered under ECCRM. Team receives 50 to 60 Service Requests in SAS Deployment tower on a Monthly basis. Customer is aware of the drawback in the Service Now Ticketing Tool. 

Condition : Ticketing tool does not have the option to pull the report on Response and Resolution time for the Service Requests handled in SAS Deployment tower. Hence Team has been manually tracking to provide the compliance on Internal SLA/KPI. 

Consequence : Manual reporting is more prone to human errors and the Accuracy of the reports circulated or data presented in PMR gets reduced.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: As of the request start time and end time is captured in the ServiceNow tool itself. Based on that we calculate the  turnaround and response time.  When the report is extracted it is designed in such a way that the other parameters are captured except the turnaround and response time fields
Contingency Plan Description: We will try to follow up with third party team who is maintaining and managing the reporting tool to get the appropriate report if that could be enhanced in the future by them.

Risk Description:
Context: Team works in 3 Modules 1) SAS Deployment with 4 Resources, 2) Change Module has 3 resources and 3) Cycle Module has 3 Resources. Team has 10 Resources in Offshore, The project was running with 4 Associate designation and 5 PA level and 1 Engineer Trainee during Q1 2016 

Condition: Now the project has 1 SA Level, 7Associate level and 2PA Level resources in Offshore location to provide the same scope of support which has been offered for the past 18months. Team needs to quickly check for Resource Optimization by including more Fresher’s and Programmer level designation resources as the scope of support is also limited. 

Consequence: If Job rotation was planned effectively, Customer Profitability would not have dipped.
Mitigation Plan Description: Team resizing is planned for the next quarter, therefore optimization will be enhanced among the team members.
Contingency Plan Description: Resource pyramid will be considered for this team resizing which is planned for the next quarter.

Risk Description:
This is T&M AVM Project. Project team is working on Development and Maintenance. Primary technology is .NET  and SSIS/SSRS Tools like MSBI. However, there is, No / Slow response on Excel Open and save and continues Hanging issue to JPMC using VPN.

Some Development hamper due to this as it uses excel object to download the grid..the project runs the risk of Low Productivity. This will inturn lead to Low productivity.

Until the issue is resolved, Work in Excel is being done by other team member in the team.

Risk Description: The monthly extract report is created on 2nd of every month based on the value date. Hence, if some transactions are loaded after 2nd, there is a risk that they will never be extracted even in the next month's extract
Mitigation Plan Description: As a mitigation plan, we are planning to schedule the job in the beginning as well as end of the month to cover the complete extract
Contingency Plan Description: As a contingency plan, we will be extracting the report manually at the end of the month and send it to business apart from the automatic extract at the beginning of the month.

Risk Description: Delays in getting the environment setup: To start with System/UAT Testing, the environments should be available with stable condition before the start date of testing. If the environments are not ready and stable, there will be an impact in defect detections and schedule for starting/completion of the testing.
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant will escalate the issue in advance whenever there is need in performing an environment setup activity by Northern Trust. If the environment setup is delayed and if it causes additional cost/effort a change request will be raised for the additional cost/effort expended.
Contingency Plan Description: Cognizant will escalate the issue in advance whenever there is need in performing an environment setup activity by Northern Trust. If the environment setup is delayed and if it causes additional cost/effort a change request will be raised for the additional cost/effort expended.

Risk Description: Source code is not is SCLM production region/PVCS: If current production version source code of mainframe components or PB components provided by Northern Trust is not available in PVCS, and if a change needs to done in those components, then there is chance for functionalities getting missed.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Stability & Adequacy of Technology; Inherited System
Mitigation Plan Description: Source code for Java are currently maintained in TFS and the stored procedure are maintained in PVCS. Every changes done for the release will be checked-in the repository before going for build. Before moving to any source control repository, NT will take care of earlier codes with the help of Product SMEs.
Contingency Plan Description: A new branch will be created from the production version of last release and the changes corresponding to the current release will be checked-in in the new branch. It mean for every release there will be label or placeholder to retrieve files. With that at any given time we could get the source code version of earlier releases.

Risk Description: When a resource is moving out of NT project (due to release/resignation), the current position of the resource getting released should be replaced with another resource, who possess the required skills. The replacement should be done before the current resource gets released from the project, such that there is an overlapping in timeline, where in the required KT about the project/work handled by current resource can be given to the new resource. If this doesnâ€™t happen then there will be an impact in delivery timelines.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: Every resource will share their knowledge of the module at the end of reach release in which they are currently working on and a document will be prepared for future reference. It will avoid dependency with single resource. All resources are aware of the business and requirement. KB articles will be revisited periodically and updated on each release.
Contingency Plan Description: When a resource is about to exit, KT plan will be prepared with list of components he/she has worked and date will be fixed for each module. A detailed documentation will be done by the resource who is exiting and the reverse KT will also be documented.

Risk Description: Detailed Business requirements are provided by Northern Trust for each release. As part of requirement analysis phase, Cognizant onsite and offshore team will raise queries to client if we are not clear on any of the requirements or if they have missed / assumed some part. It is important that these queries should be clarified by client in a timely manner, since delay in receiving the clarifications will impact timelines for delivery.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description:
"Timely resolutions of all the issues raised is important to contain this risk, as the project is going to be executed in planned schedule.
An issue tracking SIR database to log and track issues will be used. Issues will be highlighted in status reports."
Contingency Plan Description:
"Timely resolutions of all the issues raised is important to contain this risk, as the project is going to be executed in planned schedule.
An issue tracking SIR database to log and track issues will be used. Issues will be highlighted in status reports."

Risk Description: Requirement changes even after requirements freeze period. It is happened due continuous business changes, Northern Trust might report changes to requirement. If the changes are brought in during design/coding phase, then it will impact the timeline and effort estimated, since there are rework required at analysis/design/coding level.
Mitigation Plan Description: When changes reported by Northern Trust during the design/coding/testing phase, then Cognizant will do a detailed analysis on the area of impact/testing strategies and come up with estimated on effort required and the timelines when it can be delivered, reason on whether it can be accommodated with current release and if not. These will be communicated to all stakeholders. Based on the discussion on clients consent Cognizant will proceed with reschedule/replan /onboard new resources etc and implement the changes and deliver to client.
Contingency Plan Description: Cognizant will establish and follow a robust change management procedure. Cognizant will provide status reports and project plans on a weekly basis highlighting impacts, effort, cost and schedule. Key stakeholders of the Northern Trust team will be made aware of the project schedule and associated dependencies/ requirements. The schedule including key deliverables and milestones will be conveyed well in advance to all Northern Trust stakeholders so that they can plan the delivery..

Risk Description: Application is built upon latest technologies. It is mandatory that Subject Matter Experts(SMEs) are available for each technology in order to address the technical queries raised or issues/challenges faced. If the SMEs are not available at Northern Trust during the period of project implementation, then there will be an impact in quality, timelines and effort.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant technology team working at onsite spent more than 5 years and they are working as SME now on business and technology areas. Continuous update in technical skills by onsite team will make them come good as SMEs in all area. Onsite team is doing that currently.
Contingency Plan Description: Northern Trust is having Architects and SMEs for each technology and they are addressing our queries. Our onsite team is in constant touch with Line managers on NT SMEs. Line Managers is fine with on Cognizant supports to provide SME.

Risk Description:
Communication gap in delivering the resolution to the user on time.

Risk Description: There are a less clarity on the requirements provided by the clients. The Project Requirements are given out by the clients. And these requirements are not clear and are very brief. So the developers have to send out  a lot of clarification mails  to the Clients on the functionality to be developed. And the Clients are also not sure about the requirements. Hence they wait for the confirmation from the Business Users and then pass on the information to the developers. This in turn leads to re-work and also the deadline is affected .Mostly the requirement keeps on changing and gets pushed to next cycle. So the requirement will be pushed to the backlogs and worked in the next cycle.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Continual Service Improvement Beyond the Contract
Mitigation Plan Description: Currently for all the requirement gaps, we seek clarifications and we push it to the backlog queue so that it can be taken for reanalysis and development in the next cycle and move on to  the next workable requirement in the current cycle that can be delivered . This is also agreed upon by the Clients. This way  the developers will be able to focus on the workable requirements rather than waiting on the response for the clarifications raised
Contingency Plan Description: To avoid this situation, the plan would be to split  the analysis of the requirements into 1 phase and its corresponding development into another phase. By doing so we will have ample time to analyse  the requirements and seek clarification from Business User via Clients.

Risk Name: Missing BGV Reports in personnel files
Risk Description:
During the BGV attestation exercise requested by CoreLogic (Client) it was understood that out of 3857 associates as on 30th Sept'16 for 82 associates the BGV reports were missing the employee personnel file.   As per the MSA Section 8.5 (e) the supplier personnel on boarded to perform services for CoreLogic account are required to undergo background checks per CoreLogic requirements and non-availability of BGV reports in the personal files will amount to non-compliance.

Further investigation revealed that the BGV process had evolved over a period of time post acquisition wherein, initially BGV checks at respective CoreLogic locations (BLR / MLR & HYD) were carried out by location specific HR personal and the reports were stored at the respective locations by the concerned HR personnel.  In Sept 2013, the BGV SOP was revisited and the Cognizant central BGV team took over and the adherence to BGV process across locations was monitored centrally from Cognizant Chennai location, also, the e-storage of the personal files was initiated.   

Out of 82 records, 64 records are prior to acquisition (17th Aug 11) cases.
Mitigation Plan Description:
The Corporate Security team along with the BGV HRSS team has recommended the following corrective steps:
•	To re-initiate the BGV for all the 82 records immediately
•	The BPS & ITO HR – Talent managers to brief the associates regarding the process and the back ground for re-initiating the BGV
Contingency Plan Description:
•	To revisit CoreLogic BGV SOP and re-iterate the process to all the concerned stakeholders from Project / BGV HRSS team
•	BGV HRSS team to conduct a monthly reconciliation of employee personnel file and report the status with PMO team
•	PMO team to validate and share the report with the client team

Risk Description:
The producer admin (PA) stream has few outbound files that have been developed for quite some time. These data in the files have been tested in the past. The customer has realized that there are few other scenarios (use for generating these outbounds) that have been missed in the original requirements e.g. future registration. The CR aims to implement these extraction criteria. 
Since the code has undergone testing, implementing this CR may break functionally tested code.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Team will be building on the existing design there by ensuring that existing transformation logic stays intact and impact is minimal. 

11/28/2016
Reserve function has been implemented and code has been moved to Dev2. The testing stared on Friday 11/25/2016.Will continue to monitor

12/12/2016
28 defects were raised till 09/12/2016. 
As per analysis done here is the classification: 
7 - Invalid 
12 - Data issue
CR - 7 
Duplicate - 1
New data scenario - 1
The above data has been communicated to the customer 

12/12 - 26 other defects have been reported and team is in the process of analyzing those. 

15-Jan-2017
All high RF defects have been closed apart from defect 173/174 where multiple changes occurring on the same day have not been implemented across any interface. The defects along with RF code will be moved to QA secondary on 17th-Jan-2017. Team to continue to monitor integration O/B

09-March-2017
The code has been moved to UAT and outbounds are being generated from UAT. There are few RF related defects that team still needs to close however original code seems to be running fine in UAT so far. Will continue to monitor this risk.

Risk Description: The current CA design requires optimization. The current code was build on the requirement that were gradually discovered by the BAs. Due to this pipeline may run for a longer time if code moves to Production. Team has created a plan for optimizing and are in the process of changing the design and rules in TrueComp. However this will require regression testing by BA and subsequently another round of UAT has to be done. However changing design so late in the project may require some additional testing.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Team has already identified the components that require optimization. A plan has shared with customer to optimize this and also agreed upon. However plan for BA regression is yet to be finalized. 

09-March-2017
Team completed the optimization however BAs indicated that it would require 18 weeks to regression this code. Moreover Callidus have indicated that production hardware configuration would be able to handle the expected data load and completion of pipeline would not be a problem. AIU PM has also indicated there would be a window of 3 months after go-live where optimization can be pushed f need be. The risk would be kept open till one round of performance testing is not completed.

Account Name: John Hancock Life Insurance Company- USA
Risk Description: PVUL17 code freeze date is 30th march, but the requirements of few of the functionality is still in progress. Due to the late availability of the requirements we will require to modify the allocations  and there is a possibility that we may need an extension on the delivery date of these functionalities.
Mitigation Plan Description: We will revisit the requirements and accordingly modify the allocation of the resources. Thus we shall try to meet the original freeze date.
Contingency Plan Description: In the scenario we are unable to complete the changes within the delivery date; we will discuss with the project team on the priority of the functionalities and perform the delivery in phase.

Risk Description:
Risk: NFR and device specific expectations are yet to be finalized. Not finalizing the NFRs and the list of devices may lead to the risk of not meeting the implicit requirements.
Impact: thereby leading to potential rework and defect leakage in later stages.
Mitigation Plan Description: NFRs identified. Performance Benchmarks already exists for old application. Device specifications discussed.

Risk Description:
This is Fixed Bid AD Project. Project team is working on Analysis. Primary technology is Java. However, The project is call point migration of corba service to web service. There is dependency on customer for the availability of web services. 
If the web services are not made available on time it can lead to timeline slippage
. This will result in Schedule Slippage. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Rework / high defect leakage. This will inturn lead to Additional rework.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Continuous follow up with Service team and reporting of any deviation for service availability/technical issues is highlighted in WSR

Risk Description:
This is Fixed Bid AD Project. Project team is working on Analysis. Primary technology is Java. However, CORBA and web service database sync up required on time.
Database sync up is required for avoiding data discrepancies. 

Delay in sync up will result in data discrepancies. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Inadequate / lack of Quality control Process / Calibration. This will in turn lead to Additional rework.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description:
Continuous follow up required with database owner for data sync up.
This risk already added in WSR

Risk Description:
This is Fixed Bid AD Project. Project team is working on Analysis. Primary technology is Java. However, This is CORBA to web service migration project.
Performance testing of migrated web services will be done by CS and not in our scope which is mentioned in contract as well

In case of performance issue of web services, web service team will be responsible for the same and will provide proper solution for the same.

This will result in Data quality issue. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Inadequate / lack of Quality control Process / Calibration. This will inturn lead to Additional rework.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: In case of performance issue, continuous follow up would be required with web service team.

Risk Name: AD service is not up and running
Risk Description: This is T&M AD Project. Project team is working on Coding. Primary technology is .NET. However, there is, Ad Service is not up and running which is used for sending Email to the user in test environment is not up and running. This will result in issue in consuming the web service in the code and Testing. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Dependency on product / Supplier management process not defined. This will in turn lead to Not Meeting on Time delivery.
Mitigation Plan Description: Ad service is a Dot net web service which is used to get the user details from the active directory, which is supplied by a third party vendor to BB&T.  Working with the third party vendor who supplies the web service, in order to make it usable in our coding. since we are facing issue in using the wsdl. This can be done by obtaining the credentials for the web service.  we can configure it with a service account credentials so that issue will get resolved. so we have asked for the credentials. and we are waiting for the reply from the  vendor.

Project Name: BB T NET Apps AVM Support
Risk Description: This is T&M AM Project. Project team is working on Design. Primary technology is .NET. However, there is, VDI Issue. This will result in possible delay in schedule by 1 day. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Low Productivity. This will in turn lead to Not Meeting on Time delivery.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description:
The following best practices would be implemented in the project to reduce the VDI Connectivity  issues
1)  Log-Off  VDI Desktops properly in  daily basis
2) Avoid frequent  Restart in Cognizant machine
3) Clean up temporary file in the cognizant machine in daily basis

Risk Name: Transformation plan not up to date
Risk Description:
RISK ID-83 - Overall transformation plan (migration and decommissioning) is not up to date due to various delays. This might result in additional cost impact.

Mitigation Level: High
Priority: 1
RISK Owners: Herman Schoenmaker (CTS); Joachim Klinke (AGI)
RISK Area (Tower): Transformation
Region: Global
Mitigation Plan Description: Finalize full migration plan for ITO and Oracle move groups

Risk Description:
Context: AGI is currently going through Transformation phase on all 3 regions including Eu, US and APAC. There are 30 servers in APAC migrated to FMO environment starting 4th Feb. DR runbooks to restore these servers and ITO applications are not available. 


Condition: DR document needs to be updated by Cognizant and submitted to AGI before 15th March.

Consequence: In case of DR incident, team does not have the documented procedure to restore the servers and ITO applications in DR location.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: DR documentation is in progress and awaiting for sign off.
Contingency Plan Description: DR Test is planned to be conducted in UAT environment.

Risk Description:
Context: AGI is an ITO deal currently going through transformation phase. Database is one of the towers which is part of the transformation. Oracle production database is planned to be moved next week as part of the FMO migration activity. However as per the contract,  Monitoring is not setup in Solarwinds for these databases. Also AGI was not informed on this and no alternatives planned. 

Condition: All production database and servers need to have monitoring and backup scheduled as per the agreed policy

Consequence: Failing to have the systems under monitoring will lead to business disruption and legal consequences due to violation of contractual terms.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Solar Winds monitoring to be enabled on all FMO device. Technical feasibility is explored for 18 devices in EU region
Contingency Plan Description: Critsit process will be evoked if Oracle production database goes down

Risk Name: Handover migrated EU servers to BAU
Risk Description:
Context: AGI Project is currently undergoing transformation phase, As part of the transformation process, PS team to handover the servers to BAU. However Handover process is yet to start for EU region. overall 70 servers have been migrated but only one server has been handed over. 

Condition: As per the hyper care support all servers that were migrated to be handed over to BAU. 

Consequence: If Handover process is not smooth with proper sharing of Migration tracker with date , server name, CMO/FMO IP , application and related technology it would be difficult to provide continued support by BAU time which could result in delayed resolution if any of the servers go down in production.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
Context: 

As part of the FMO < Transformation phase> , Cognizant is supporting AGI on SimpliVity platforms using SimpliVity plugin  integrated with VMware. Currently SimpliVity capacity is a concern because only 70% of allocated capacity can be used from the data stores. And since we depend on thin provisioning of storage we could expect a high number of disk capacity related incidents.

Condition:

Simplivity capacity needs to be in-line with current storage capacity. If not,  reasons & expectations to be communicated to stakeholders. 

Consequence:

Should there by a Failure with disk , Prod environment is expected to halt for at least 4 hours which would result in huge business disruption.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Discussion in progress
Contingency Plan Description: If disk issues reported Critsit process will be invoked.

Risk Description:
Context:
Solarwinds implementation is posted @ 31 March’17. Currently monitoring tower has 12 member team to look after the monitoring activities,  since the events are not aggregated in SNOW and team would have to continue having these resources. 
Condition: 
This needs to be implemented before full FMO to enable GSCC movement. Also we are presently reporting the availability manually whereas it should be automated
Consequence:
Any delay in Solarwinds implementation would impact move to GSSC/CP% and MO plan.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Discussion in progress

Risk Description:
Context: 
ACE Dev team is resolving application defects/gaps coming out of Closeout Conversion. 
These are QCs and/or enhancements as assigned to the team. These items require very quick turn around time due to the nature of the issues. 

Condition:
We are observing some occasions where there remains a considerable gap in inter-team communication. These gaps are being closed in a day or two, but these require more seamless communication to address customer concerns.

Consequence:
A communication gap in these work items may quickly lead to incomplete understanding of requirement and schedule slippage.
Mitigation Plan Description:
1) Status of conversion related defects assigned to Dev BAU team, to be discussed in existing status calls (happens thrice a week)
2) Daily sync up with Dev BAU offshore and onshore, around these defects
3) Random probing by offshore managers on the status
Contingency Plan Description: Any QC/SPRS related to Conversion issues, is being separately tracked by offshore managers to avoid any inter-team communication gap.

Risk Description:
This project is about Informatica upgrade to a newer version. Metlife is responsible to provide the stable platform for this activity. Delay in availability of stable platform made us push the start of the project by 2 months.

Unavailability of stable platform is impeding planned progress. It seems we will miss Release 4.0 for the implementation. 
If platform is not ready by end of December, we may have to extend project end date by 2 months.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Dependency grid with dates have been shared with customer. We are preparing all necessary scripts beforehand, which can be immediately applied when platform is available.
Contingency Plan Description: Extra resources are being deployed for a short period to pull as maximum amount of work as possible. From December 2016 onward,  we are deploying only PATs in the project to minimize hit on profitability.

Risk Description: This is compliance test project T&M using mainframe technology. The team is importing all the production data to test environment. As the production volume is huge the test environment is unable this data. Which is in turn delaying batch execution time in test.
Mitigation Plan Description: Run DB maintenance activity, like REORG and RUNSTATS before starting the batch. This will refresh DB paths and indexes which will optimize batch performance.
Contingency Plan Description: Contact DBA team to identify Contingency Plan, if necessary.

Risk Description: Context - Functional enhancement in scope. Team works on Quarterly releases and also Adhoc monthly Releases. Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
Context: The platform has been built based on various components like TrvPas, Service and JRule. Service performs the core logic based upon the inputs it receives from TrvPas component in real time and interacts very closely with TrvPas for all processing in the application. Hence we can say that service and TrvPas teams are dependent on each other to fix issues during the development. A service piece of deliverable may have to wait until the TrvPas has been fixed. This is applicable in the other way as well. 
Condition: When the service team is stuck with something related to TrvPas and there is no band width for the configurators to look into this issue(Vice versa)
Consequence: Delay in Delivery.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Team is getting cross training in both service and trvpas.
Contingency Plan Description: Team is getting cross training in both service and trvpas.

Mitigation Plan Description: Follow ups and discussions are in progress with the customer to finalize the requirement.

Risk Description:
Context: No dedicated resource for front end consumer system (OLB) is currently available. Also, there is no confirmed date by when they will be available.

Condition: If no dedicated OLB resource is allocated as soon as possible

Consequence: As no dedicated resource from the consumer system is currently available, the confirmation of request/response schema of our service & the various interaction model between us (service provider) & OLB (consumer) are currently based on a number of assumptions. If anything changes at a later point, then there might be a risk to the timeline.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: We have requested to RBC management for a dedicated OLB resource for finalization of the pending items.
Contingency Plan Description: Currently we have stubbed the required data based on our assumptions.

Risk Description:
Context: As  part of the process migration activities, 3 associates – 1 from Hyderabad and 2 from Pune had to travel for the onshore KT and then come back and conduct the offshore training in the respective locations.  
Condition: Visa for the Hyderabad associate has not been processed successfully and the passport was sent without visa stamping. Hence the associate cannot travel for the onshore KT
Consequences: In case of Hyderabad associate not travelling for KT, there would not be any resource available in Hyderabad to conduct the offshore KT

Mitigation Plan: 2 Associates are travelling from Pune for the onshore KT and upon their return to India one of them will travel to Hyderabad to conduct the Offshore KT.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--
Contingency Plan Description: One resource from Pune travelled  to Hyderabad to train the resources along with remote training for a week.

Risk Description:
New servers will be used for CPM production deployment. CPM application will use multiple servers for WFE, App, Database.

No prerequisites will be present in the servers as these are brand new and also connectivity between servers and frameworks will be untested before the actual deployment.

It may happen that during production deployment prerequisites and connectivity may not work resulting in delay of  GO LIVE.

Risk Name: Differnece observed in FSD and codebase
Risk Description:
CPM FSD has been prepared by mining the existing Delphi code. 

Significant differences have been observed during development, test case design and SIT.

This may result in higher defect density during UAT.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Stability & Adequacy of Technology; Inherited System
Mitigation Plan Description:
In SIT phase the eixsting codebase has been revisited and the developed modules have been modified by spending additional effort.

Business users have been engaged in the SIT phase to validate the major functionalities.

A set of demos organized with business users and mitigated the risk to significant extent.

Risk Description: Less knowledge of APACHE SPARK in the current team is impacting the timelines of the AFDS Amendment 10 project.
Mitigation Plan Description: Team is learning the SPARK technology and doing POC to solve the problem statement of the project.

Risk Description:
WO 15 will get monthly resource allocation based on Client Project demand and resulting in Ramp up/Ramp down of Resources

If the Project forecast is not carefully done, there will be ups/downs in Resource Forecast

Due to which either we will have less Profitability or Delivery deadlines will be missed.

Risk Description: Project is in SIT phase. Primary technology is Informatica. There are Conversion failure issues causing delay in running our SIT cycles. This will result in Schedule slippage as we have already consumed time for two cycles, but not even one cycle is completed due to the conversion issues.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Re-planning to be done based on States and higher priority states will be released first on time followed by lower priority states
Contingency Plan Description: In future releases time of conversion testing, validation and fixes needs to be considered

This will result in Time line increased for replacement. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Resource unavailability - offshore / onshore / Skill matrix not available. This will intern lead to Not Meeting on Time delivery.

Risk Description:
1. The service endpoint for "Save and Retrieve Quote" and  "Retrieve Multiple Quote for PolicyCenter from FFQ" integration are not ready. 
	Our delivery plan will affect the delay in the services offered by the third party vendors. Due to this , we can't able to deliver the task on time and the IUT will be delayed. 
2.The existing GW Mule Services are not configured  in cloud environment :	This is also offered by the third party and they were not providing the services will affect the delivery plan and the IUT will be delayed.

1. Inform the service delay to client via onsite.
2. Complete the development based on some mock service.
Contingency Plan Description: Complete the development based on some mock services and data.

Risk Description:
Context - Sync functionality is not working between the form factors
Condition - We should be able to sync the data updated in all form factors
Consequence - Data sync will fail if we do not include all tablet related changes in smartphone
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Tablet and web versions are updated with all recent changes but this is not yet taken into smartphone version. Smartphone development is working on the tagged version of tablet. We need to include all tablet related changes as CR for smartphone to eliminate sync failures

Risk Name: Same Version for all form factors
Risk Description:
Context - Currently we have all three form factors (web, tab and smartphone) in different versions
Condition - All the three form factors should be in same version
Consequence - If all form factors are not in same version it will not work in sync
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: To have all form factors in same version, further tablet release need to wait till smartphone catches up with all changes that tablet has implemented

Risk Description: Out of the 48 UAT defects reported so far in both cycle 1 and 2 together, RCA categorization for majority of the defects is identified as ‘Mapping Change’. It’s because of incorrect mapping provided for values between IL (External source system) and the fields in the report. This is not identified in unit testing or SIT as only report generation is focused and only in UAT actual users test the values. Only the users are aware of the correct mapping between the IL and report fields. Identifying these defects only in UAT phase will lead to rework in the development and retesting.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
Context: AMP is a Development project and initially was operated in agile mode. But, from after September release waterfall model has been implemented.Currently there are 2 resources working from offshore and 0.5 resource from on-site. This project has scheduled deliveries in the month of March 2017. QA and UAT sign-off has been received for March release. Technologies involved are Dot Net and Database is SQL Server 2008R2.

Condition : After UAT sign off, client has given few code review comments and they want the same to be addressed for the March 3rd 2017 release itself. Development team will be addressing the review comments and perform unit testing. There is no plan for SIT and UAT and moving the modified code to the production without completing the testing is a risk. The changes will be deployed to production on March 3 2017.

Consequence:It may have impact the production run since no QA & UAT has been done for this changes which may increase the defect count.
Mitigation Plan Description: The review comments has been implemented and unit testing & SIT has been done form developers end.But as the QA and UAT phase already over for March release so for this changes QA and UAT has not been done.This scenario is already communicated with client and they are good with this.
Contingency Plan Description: To avoid this situation, It will be ensured that,  the code review process should be completed within QA & UAT phase.

Risk Description:
Context:
PP Cycle is often executed in parallel to UAT Testing. Hence code changes to fix any UAT Defects will not be utilized in PP cycle. Hence the project runs the risk of not covering Regression issues that might crop up due to UAT Defect fixes. 
Condition:
Any defects in UAT post last PP cycle execution.  
Consequence:
Since PP cycle is a value add to existing UAT testing & project will be deployed post UAT Sign-off, hence this situation augurs a low level risk for the project..
Mitigation Plan Description: Although PP cycle is a Value Add, team is planning to have one last PP cycle after UAT sign-off. In case we discover any issues is last PP cycle, we will reach out to MetLife to redo QA + UAT.
Contingency Plan Description: If there is a UAT defect that requires code changes, PP cycle will be executed again

Risk Description: PRISM PROJECT – The volume of data for Korea is high and the existing ACE servers that handle the Korea request are slow. Team is analyzing on the application limitations for Korea that may arise due to this migration. This is an operational challenge in this project. The server capacity related issues are not part of this Meridian project team.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: EVOLUTION PROJECT – Mapping document has been provided but there is anticipated changes even during UAT phase which will lead to rework and retesting.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: Resource management plan is available and in case of any priority tasks, only the allocated resources will be shuffled across projects. There is no concrete release plan and there is no scope freeze (new requirements are added for Evolution project before unit testing phase). This will be a risk to the planned resource management. In case of any issues with resource management, client will be made aware and projects will be re-prioritized.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: QC10484 – For this issue, client has not provided any sample report nor the list of SSN’s in which the issue is identified. Development team randomly tested few SSN’s and analyzed the root cause. The issue was found to be with Portable policies only. The data should be picked from the primary group file but instead its being pulled from the portable pool plan master file. The file details were corrected to fix this issue. The risk here is that since the list of SSN’s for the  High Falls Brewing group is not given by vendor nor is the list analyzed and prepared by development team, there is a possibility of missing out testing for few SSN’s. Also, the change in the data pool file may impact the report for the ones that are coming correctly now. Extensive testing is needed for many SSN’s to prevent defect leakage.
Mitigation Plan Description: The list of SSN's will be agreed upon before testing to avoid confusion and to cover every possible scenario.
Contingency Plan Description: Discussion on test data will be done and agreed upon to avoid downfall going forward.

Risk Description: CSV tool is used for automated code review to check the standards. This tool is yet to be run for April release and as per process followed, the tool will be run only after QA/UAT sign off as there may be additional change requests after QA and UAT. But this is a risk as code change and code drop to QA/UAT region after QA/UAT testing completion leads to retest in all testing regions. Team should run the CSV tool before QA drop so that proper code is deployed for QA and UAT testing.
Mitigation Plan Description: CSV tool will be run once the testing is completed so that the proper code is dropped to QA.
Contingency Plan Description: CSV tool will be run for each release before QA to deploy code with proper standard.

Account Name: Chubb IT Development Centre Sdn. Bhd.
Risk Description: KT phase at onsite for the 2 new resources was planned for 4 weeks in December 2016 during which client SME’s shared details on the products in EBIS platform and the expected requirements to rewrite the products in AMS platform. No formal KT document was created by the team. An understanding document is prepared but since AMS platform is vast, without formal KT sessions a new joiner will not be able to understand the document. There is no Architecture document/diagram and environment details shared by client. This is a risk as a formal KT for another 4 weeks is time consuming and is not sponsored by client. Recommended to come up with detailed KT plan and split the KT topics to multiple sections or documents which will enable easier understanding.
Mitigation Plan Description: Flow diagram of the application functionality is to be created for understanding the application.

Account Name: Chubb IT Development Centre Sdn. Bhd.
Risk Description: As part of the EBIS platform, the data is stored in DB2 and this is rewritten in AMS as an xml which will be stored in the SQL tables. Data mapping between the DB2 fields and the xml tags is not provided by client. Delay in this will impact project schedule.
Mitigation Plan Description: Onsite team to work closely with their local IT team and try to finish it as soon as possible.

Account Name: Chubb IT Development Centre Sdn. Bhd.
Risk Description: he project ESA end date is Dec 15 2017 but the project plan is available only till Mar 31 and the additional CRs may extend the project by a month further. Scope for rest of the year is unclear. It is expected to get more products for rewriting in AMS platform from offshore as cognizant has invested in the KT.
Mitigation Plan Description: To discuss periodically with onsite team to understand the scope after the current project.

Risk Description:
Context: VPN to VDI migration is  a critical risk for our projects. Each user need to set up their  project work space in VDI within the time . Currently we are doing development activities with VPN.
Condition:  This  will be  stopped if user is not migrating to VDI as VPN access will be revoked after migration. VDI is still slow for development.
Consequence: This can have serious impact on teams productivity.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Currently a new UAT environment is created for few users. This users testing in UAT profile. Once the UAT is stable, this will moves to production.
Contingency Plan Description: All users have VPN access till the successful migration of VDI. This will helps to continue the development activities.

Account Name: The Prudential Insurance Co. of America
Risk Description:
Context: This is an insurance project from Pramerica, which offers a vast range of business and technology services to the parent company, Prudential Financial, Inc., including designing of their marketing collaterals like Brochures, Flyer, Bios, etc. The current FTE count is 6. Here BCP agreement per SOW states that, "Vendor to meet 60% of normal operating capacity within 24 business hours from the time of disaster, meet 80% of normal operating capacity within 72 business hours and meet 100% of normal operating capacity within 120 business hours". 

Condition: As per BCP Plan, MEPZ is the primary Site,  CRC - Chennai (Intra City) & Coimbatore - CCC (Inter City) are recovery sites. Around 90% of volume is processed using Mac systems, and only 10% of volume requires Windows PC. Lack of Mac Systems in the recovery sites would be a risk of not meeting the BCP requirement

Consequence: To mitigate the risk, team has proposed next batch to be delivered out of Bangalore location, however the risk would exist until it is implemented for the current processes that are transitioned so far.
Mitigation Plan Description: We are in discussion with client to use client site as the BCP site till we get a go-ahead from client to set up an alternate site.

Risk Name: Complete Automation for markit Option ma
Risk Description: This is T&M AD - Agile Project. Project team is working on Delivery. Primary technology is C++ and C#. However, There is no regression Test suite available which covers all regression test cases of Markit Option Matching Project .It leads to  gaps in the overall testing coverage required to ensure defect free deliveries into production. Regression cycle to cover all use cases is bit large and it is not possible to execute it on short notice in the event of quick changes required.This will result in Probability and risk of defect injection into production  and thus comprising with quality of program deliverables. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Rework / high defect leakage. This risk of not being able to undertake execution of full regression cycle needs to be mitigated.
Mitigation Plan Description: Plan to cover all Use cases for Markit Option Matching Program under regression cases. Automate the execution of all these test cases so to enable complete coverage of functionality of this program. This risk arising out of scenario of complete regression not happening will be mitigated by implementing automation approach.

Risk Description:
Context:
There are multiple applications supported by this team which includes wmA , SmartApp, MRPS and AH. For each application the team needs to support different activities such as QA/Prod parallel cycles, implementation activities and defect analysis. There is one billable resource for each activity for each application
Condition:
Absence or unavailability of any resource in case of any critical scenario during the support hours.
Consequence:
It would impact existing resource shift plan and as a result, execution SLA would be impacted for QA cycles, impact on deliverables for PP cycle, defect support and implementation activities.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: Cross training the team members for different application area for different activities supported by the team in each area.
Contingency Plan Description: In case of any critical situation where the existing team member would not be available , support will be provided by AD team for that application area to avoid any impact to delivery.

Risk Name: VPN to VDI Migration - May Release
Risk Description:
Context : All VPN users are getting migrated to VDI
Condition: There were lot of Performance issues in VDI. If it is not resolved we would not be able to continue our development in VDI within the Sprint.
Consequence: If VPN is revoked, we will not be able to deliver within the specified timelines
VPN access will be revoked after migration.
Each user need to set up their  project work space in VDI within the time.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Current  development activities is going on with VPN.  VPN access will be revoked after VDI migration is successful. Users got access to VDI. Each user need to set up their  project work space in VDI within the time and do performance testing. 
User have both VPN & VDI connectivity during the migration.
Contingency Plan Description: We have daily  checklist to track the progress. Also the user have both VPN & VDI connectivity during the migration. This ensure the user can continue his project work in vpn during this time.

Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams

Contingency Plan Description: Onsite team will work with QA/BA team to set up data in the grooming session itself.

Project Name: ACE GPL PRS FFIC Doc Migration
Risk Description:
Context: Migration of 10 million documents to Chubb FileNet using IBM Content Collector. Approximate total size of the documents will be 3 TB.
Condition: Sufficient space needs to be available to accommodate the 3TB documents in Chubb filenet server.  
Consequence: If sufficient space is not available to accommodate 3TB documents, then the migration job will fail and will need to be rerun which will impact the cost and schedule of the project.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Client has been apprised of this risk to take proactive steps to ensure sufficient space in target drive.
Contingency Plan Description: Add schedule contingency to start re-run of migration due to space issue.

Risk Description:
Context: NFR for the project is not available yet.

Condition: NFR is not available but build has already started. There is a chance of rework once NFR is ready.

Consequence: This will impact schedule and cost.
Mitigation Plan Description: NFR has to be ready as soon as possible to avoid any further delay.
Contingency Plan Description: In case of significant delay, timeline may get revised or contingency cost from SOW will be considered.

Risk Description:
Context:Project scope is to enable Masterpiece application processes property inspections/appraisals into a single, Centralized platform called Risk ID application. Also Performance base lining of existing Risk ID application to derive benchmark for UI and Batch jobs. Observed that there is no baseline value for performance testing w.r.t number of users and transactions time was mentioned by client. Team has been asked to run the performance testing and then Performance requirements will be fixed by the client based on the arrived values.
 Condition: Since the performance testing requirements are not explicitly mentioned by the client, there is no target value set for number of users and transactions. 
Consequence: Unavailability of requirements for Performance testing may lead to more defects in UAT and Production.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Since Cognizant scope is only in ESB, Internally we have done performance testing for the ESB services and the results are within acceptable range.
NFRs will be shared once the first round of PT is completed.

Risk Description: Netpoint upgrade changes should also be done for applications MEMFS and MemberDetailDownload. Changes has to be completed to set attributes for existing as well as new user . The SAM API will enable us to set new attributes for new users. But for existing users this will not work so we have to write a new program to set new attributes for old users,
Mitigation Plan Description: New program for setting attributes should be developed for new and old users.

Condition: The risk will materialize if the reports are not delivered for SIT testing on time. 

Consequence: If the risk materializes, it will impact the timelines for Phase 2 as there will be a delay in completion of SIT of the reports. This will impact the overall timelines and cost of the project.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Follow up with the Customer and flag any delays in weekly status reports
Contingency Plan Description: Notify the customer of the risk and ensure that a Change Request is put to cover for the extended timelines and cost.

Risk Description: This is T&M AD - Agile Project. Project team is working on Test automation and application development. Primary technology is C++, Java. However, Currently in FX BARX Trade Services project, test automation and regression testing is done using QTP. Due to cost associated with QTP license we have proposed to use in-house test framework called as BATHS. We currently have almost 1200 test cases which are executed before every production release. Plan is to move to BATHS test framework completely in next 6 months and migrate all 1200 test cases. This will result in Team will continue to use licensed QTP software to run automated regression packs. Which will have cost impact. Due to this, the project runs the risk of high cost of delivery. Which might negatively impact the clients expectations.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description: Plan is to move to BATHS test framework completely in next 6 months and migrate all 1200 test cases.  Identify and train required resources to deliver.

Risk Description:
Context: Confirms traditonal process files with DRIs more than 1000 Detail records per Header record are failing in the ETL XML generation process.

Consequences: For the intermediate time till Confirms V2 implementation the Old code will fail in the middle of the ETL process which will lead to delays in delivering the XMLs to CCP in turn it may affect our SLA.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Its better to analyze the 28 source files for the 1000 detail records issue prior to the start of the process.
Identify the particular DRI, inform the Prod Support team.
Contingency Plan Description: The Prod Support team will remove the DRI from the source & resend the corrected file to ETL & the ETL process will be started. After that the Business team will be requested for Sending Manual Confirmation to the customer..
