Risk Name: Possible Accuracy SLA miss for Nov'16
Risk Description:
Context: IPS Braintree Money IN process has Accuracy SLA target of 99.97% with 1% penalty Pool allocation.  In the month of Oct'16 a new tool "Transact IT" 
was introduced in the team for processing loans and rollover transactions. Voya conducted 2 remote training sessions of 3 hours each on 26th & 27th Oct 16 respectively. 
On 28th Oct team was instructed to start using the tool with live cases.
Condition: Total 3 FTE's used this tool post 28th Oct for processing Loans & Rollovers cases immediately post training sessions however team did not get adequate time for hands on practice on the tool before going live. 

Since team was not given time for practice and get used to the tool functionality there were 11 processing  errors within 1 week of implementing of the tool.
Consequence: Although all the errors are in dispute with Voya for getting waiver for this instance but in case of disagreement on waiver from Voya, team accuracy will close at  ~99% & hence there will be SLA miss for Nov'16. This SLA also has penalty of 1% on the risk amount agreed in the contract.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Name: Possible Accuracy SLA miss for Dec'16
Risk Description:
Context:

IPS BT MI team has accuracy SLA of 99.97% (ESL) with 1%  penalty pool allocation. 
In the month of Sep & Nov’16 , team had 2 attritions and because of which 2 FTE’s were newly hired in Nov’16. 

Condition:
Team effectively had 2 FTE’s to manage the process until the new joiners system accesses & learning curve (1 to 6 months) is over. 
Also in Dec’16 due to Sponsor Connect reporting issues, team was unable to get a correct accuracy status report on weekly basis. 
There is a possibility of missing accuracy SLA as team was not sure of how many transactions got audited and how many defects were marked.
Also due to system access issues, only 1 FTE was dedicatedly working on all 9 payrolls & other associate was working on 3 payrolls therefore there is a chance 
Of processing errors in Dec’16 which might lead to an SLA miss.

Consequence:
In case of an SLA miss, 1% penalty pool will be accrued and it will impact on account profitability.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
The scope of this project is to implent FNZ Product to the end users.
Non-Adherence of Coding Standards: Coding standards for .Net and React JS are documented and available for reference. However, there are few discrepancies noted in the sampled code files. 1 Service calls inside nested loop might impact the performance DirectClientsSearchController 2 Code analysis errors are not fixed. There are more than 1000 code analysis errors excluding naming and globalization Generic 3 Date is provided as constant rather than having as a config file. Generic 4 Extensible methods are not in place to format string etc. Free text is not removed in several places. DirectClientsSearchController 5 Cyclomatic complexity is high for few classes Generic 6 Method Summary/Comments for properties are not included Generic Non-adherence to coding standards could result in poor code quality and rework.
Mitigation Plan Description: Until the comments are incorporated in the old codes. All these code review comments are updated in the checklist and it is implemented in all the  Future delivery.

ORT: No Size estimation

Condition : Since no size estimation, there is no room to measure the productivity.

Consequence : The team would perform at the same productivity levels

Risk Name: High Defect Inject rate in WebServices
Risk Description: There a a very high Defect Injection rate (>70%) in the OK to Sell & OK to Service testing. This is resulting into more time being spent on defect re-testing. This could impact the QA testing schedule.
Mitigation Plan Description:
1) There should be more frequent meeting with the developer (Callidus) to address the issues.
2) The resources would keep the initial data setup for  testing the logged defects beforehand prior to the fix so that when the defects get fixed, the re-testing could be performed without wasting further effort in data setup during the re-testing period.
Contingency Plan Description: The test case execution would also be performed for the OK to Sell & OK to Service by the onsite resource to complete the tasks on time.

Risk Name: Large no. of ad-hoc Warranty Defects
Risk Description: There are number of Warranty enhancement Defects assigned to the Testing team each having separate target completion dates. As the number of testing resources working is less than the assigned warranty defects, it is not possible to work simultaneous on all of the warranty defects. This could result in schedule slippage.
Mitigation Plan Description: As this is a capacity based testing project, the testing team would get the warranty defects prioritized by the client to ensure that the team works on the prioritized warranty defects first. And when those prioritized items get completed, the resource moves on to work on the next prioritized item.
Contingency Plan Description: The onsite resource would take up some of the test execution task to avoid any schedule slippage.

Risk Name: Large no of data issue pending cleanup
Risk Description:
High Volume of Data Issue Pending with Metlife for Triage/Cleanup: 
SET02 (Rel 3.5)- ~ 674 records 
SET03  (Rel 4.0) - ~ 4.3K records 
• All Data Fix in Production need to be completed in phases prior to AVS Region Refresh for corresponding SETs in-order to be tested with cleaned up data. In case the data is not cleaned up before the defined timelines, testing will not happen on the cleaned up data and any downstream issue with the impacted lives cannot be uncovered and might result in non-conversion of the impacted contract.
Mitigation Plan Description: Data cleanup plan with cleanup need by dates (2/23 for SET02 and 5/12 for SET03) reviewed and shared with Metlife. Continuous monitoring of progress and reporting to customer of the risk on a regular basis.

Risk Description:
Context- ICC was supposed to send complete XML field mapping by 12/26, but only 33% of data received. 

Condition- Because of this reason adequate work on the mapping activity and corresponding design on mapping dependent items are on hold now. As of this week, approximate effort loss is 94. 

Consequence-Given below the impact details of this deadline miss from Insurity/ ICC:
•	Analysis on the mapping will be on hold which will impact Design on XML file reading and loading in staging tables.
•	Analysis on error handling and status reporting for XML input can’t be completed.
•	Delivery of TSD and start of Coding will be delayed which was planned to be delivered by 1/13/2017 which might impact timeline of other phases. 
•	Design on XML field mapping and basic datatype validation can’t be completed within timeline.
Mitigation Plan Description:
Effort loss encountered till date and reported to the customer. As the projected date for completing the mapping and schema is not finalized so the effort loss will rise. Hence the project plan need to be re calibrated once the mapping completion is completed.
Meanwhile other design activities which are not dependent on XML file will be continued for the next week.

Risk Description: Feedback from Customer calls for existing design change
Mitigation Plan Description: Update of design structure is in progress along-with update of testing scenarios, for feedback implementation.
Contingency Plan Description: Generic plan is introduced and code reuse is planned to solve timeline issue.

Risk Name: Impact due to Version Upgrade in Jan'17
Risk Description: Introduction of new version of OIPA (V11.0) while the NLG Feasibility configuration is in-flight with OIPA 10.2 version, may impact the NLG Feasibility Implementation Timeline and Budget
Risk Sub-Dimension: Stability & Adequacy of Technology; Inherited System
Mitigation Plan Description:
Nationwide will maintain 2 environments:
1) a separate OIPA v10.2 environment/test bed as of Drop 2 (i.e. the baseline) for regression/performance testing of the OIPA v11.0 upgrade.
2) Drops 3 and 4 will be done in the upgraded environment from the beginning.
Any base code defect introduced by v11.0 upgrade which impacts NLG feasibility configuration/delivery timeline will be prioritized as critical by Nationwide and a fix expected to be provided by Oracle within 3 business days

Risk Name: Lack of Clarity & Completeness in Reqmts
Risk Description: Requirement gaps impacting FSD/HLD and Configuration timeline and increasing rework. The gaps are being unearthed while detailing out the requirements in FSD/HLD, which increase the number of iterations in the whole process.
Mitigation Plan Description:
1. Requirement (CBCi) team will conduct sessions with OIPA Config team before every workshop with NW to understand OIPA out of the box features etc.
2. A Config team member will participate in the workshop and provide OIPA perspective or help identify the gaps early in the process.
However, the above arrangement will further stretch the Config team, which is already stretched due to aggressive project timelines. Longer term mitigation might be having dedicated OIPA BA(s) augment the Requirement team.

Risk Description: Missing requirements for screen level validations: QA negative testing on such validations needs to be postponed, till validation rules are extracted from existing systems by TCS and assimilated by our Requirement team. Some of the validations are related to the New Business / Underwriting related fields opened up for data entry / update, as UD is unable to do so. This is just an interim solution, as once TPP replaces UD, these will not be required. Need to ask for Change Request for this, based on the volume of validations required.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Discussion with Customer for getting the requirements. Also internal deliberation in progress about Change Request.

Ideally BPR should have completed before Requirements. Hence, for the functionalities, which are already covered in Requirements (SRD signed-off) or configured in OIPA, we need to come back (rework) and make the changes if any impact due to business process re-engineering.

Risk Name: Idle time in QIS PI offshore team
Risk Description: Activities in QIS PI  offshore team are managed directly by Keylane team leads. Due to timezone difference, offshore associates may encounter idle time especially during morning IST hours when they wait for clarification from SME. This may also impact schedule of tasks.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description:
1. Discuss with Keylane Team Leads and suggest them to plan activities in such a way that each offshore team member has a back-up task to work on in case he/she cannot proceed with current task.
2. Create appropriate time entry codes in Maconomy to effectively capture idle time by team members.

Risk Description: Keylane team lead owns task assignment to Cognizant team (offshore). For each task, Keylane has its own estimate (in man-hours) which is based of experience and not any scientific model. Productivity or efficiency of Cognizant team is measured based on Keylane estimate. This is a risk because the team lead does not always update his estimate based on Cognizant's feedback. Cognizant's efficiency would seem low if our feedback on estimate is not accepted by the team lead for any given task.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Formalise discussions with Keylane Team Lead on Cognizant's feedback on the estimation, and work only on those tasks where estimate is jointly agreed. Create a complexity-based estimation model for medium to large tasks (> 40 hours).

Risk Description: Portal Migration project consists of vanilla migration from JavaScript to Angular JS, as well as implementing additional functionalities like Global Save and Resolve/Conflict. Technical challenges may surface when dealing with Global Save for 23 entities in Forms module.  This may result in re-assessment of the technical approach, as well as change in Keylane's proprietary new front-end framework.
Mitigation Plan Description: Keylane is planning to make changes to their proprietary new front-end framework to implement action-based flags/indicators that will be used in developing the code for Global Save and Resolve/Conflict. As a mitigation, a POC is being carried out by the team on 2 entities, making use of the framework.

Risk Description:
NFR requirement as agreed in SOW it is as mentioned "Cognizant to optimize the validation framework to be able to handle the FIX messages extracted from 30GB of application log file. The actual size of FIX messages could be less than n 30 GB. The extraction and validation of messages from 30 GB of log files should not take more than 18 hours, with reference to the baseline data shared and discussed during the Proof of Concept (POC). "

Whereas testing is done for below parameters, due to environment constraint :
Size :55 MB
No of records : 180000 records
No of records in FIX msg table :180000
Time taken :140 min

Based on ratio proportion calculation it is assumed that framework should work fine in production as per expectation. Failure to test for actual scenarios as mentioned in contract may result in rework and customer dissatisfaction.
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: Frequent outages are happening in CIT causing impact to QA to execute test cases. The ticket has been raised to Middle ware team in  customer and they are working on it.
Mitigation Plan Description:

2.    Connection pool issue which requires to re-start the CIT instances and the environment is down temporarily. Temporary fix only is provided ,but no permanent solution yet .
3.  Frequent memory issues . DBA has been requested to look into this.
4.  Runtime exception “Failed to get file from remote repository” . Workaround has been provided to re-deploy .
  CASE 01780752 has been raised with Redhat for this issue.  Jboss server fails to start with fatal boot   error . Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.4.11.
Contingency Plan Description:
Downtime for environment is tracked and informed to customer.
QA schedule needs to be monitored in case environment slippage is causing impact.
Duplicate CIT environment is needed for contingency ,so QA can continue the progress on other environment.

Risk Description: Currently we have 9 consumers to consume messages from the queue.  To process 1000000 messages, system takes almost 10 hours.  If we get more number of messages then there is delay in the response
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description: We raised a request to truncate the data on every weekend which gives us better performance until we implement the change.
Contingency Plan Description: We increased the listeners count.  created few indexes on columns for the better query performance.  Rather than inserting all the data which comes in, first we validate whether we need to process this message or not.  If we this is valid message then we persist into the database.  It avoids unnecessary values in the Database.  Introduced a purge job as well which runs on each day.

Context : Upstream and online data unavailability.
Condition : The risk can occur during batch delays due to abend in our system or in upstream system and delay due to resource unavailability.
Consequences : Due to this risk users won't be able to access the required information on time.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
Mitigation Plan Description: To continue with the business operation we can ignore the upstream data feed and process the rest all available feeds.
Contingency Plan Description: To reduce the impact in our process the upstream data can be ignored and can process with available feeds.

Risk Description: INT/QA Environment Availability
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--
Contingency Plan Description: Regular Follow up with the customer to understand the Availability of Environment

Risk Name: Application KT is pending from client
Risk Description:
Context: Project scope is to work on Adhoc requests which includes Design, Coding & Testing.For few applications KT is pending from Client. 
Condition: Though there is no tasks assigned till date in those applications, KT has to be done.
 Consequence: Since KT is pending from client end,if task is assigned for those applications may lead to Schedule variation in the project.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: Need to discuss with onsite members reg KT for the applications which is pending and they can assist offshore by sharing their knowledge.
Contingency Plan Description: SMEs from client side can help to acquire knowledge on the required applications

Risk Name: Possible network latency issue via VDI
Risk Description: Possible network latency issue via VDI
Mitigation Plan Description: VDIs issues has been escalated / sorted out and quick turn around time reported for the VDI requests raised recently. Desktops/Laptops planned in additional to avoid the delay in UI start.
Contingency Plan Description: Plan the work based on the delay

Risk Description: Redesigned application would be cross platform, cross browser compatible and support mobile. Browsers like IE11, Edge, Firefox, Chrome, Safari (Version current-1) are defined in SOW. however which O.S. and versions of O.S. will be supported is not defined. Lack of clarity on O.S. to be supported may risk of rework and not meeting customer expectations.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Cross mobile/cross browser dev and testing -  devices and versions identified and discussed as part of Test strategy and submitted to Customer for approval.

Risk Description: There are multiple SOW's. SOW's are not signed off yet. Lack of signed SOW may risk of scope creep and contractual obligations.
Mitigation Plan Description: Out of 3 SOWs , 2 got signed (UX, Framework) and approach for SOWs finalized, though not the lead time. Services, Testing and Post production efforts has been spilt across all the modules and each module will have one SOW signed going forward.

Project Name: MM USIG Datawiki POC and Asses
Risk Description: In context with the code update and to implement the requirement in a short time, Mediawiki core files are changed to implement business functionalities in pilot phase. On a condition of the MediaWiki updation, these files can be overwritten when the baseline version of Mediawiki is deployed into respective environments and as a consequence, the update done in the core files will be missed and replaced by the files in the new MediaWiki update.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Defined Business Value from the Engagement
C2-Subproject: MM USIG Datawiki POC and Asses (218036)
Mitigation Plan Description:
Extensions to be developed in Phase 2. Expected to start around mid Feb. 
MM are rethinking on the overall end to end view of the portal and hence phase 2 start or requirement gathering workshop will be delayed.
Contingency Plan Description:
Keep  MM apprised of the core file changes if any for business requirements and update/ correct the same for any future deployments
MM are rethinking on the overall end to end view of the portal and hence phase 2 start or requirement gathering workshop will be delayed. Extension creation only to be part of Phase 2

Account Name: American Express Travel Rltd Svcs Co,Inc
Risk Description:
Risk Cause: Requirements Identified After UAT validations.

 Risk condition: Getting clarity on new requirements.

 Consequences: E2E time lines for soft launch validations are getting delayed.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Following up with product owner for new requirement details and its timelines.

Risk Description:
Context
We are yet to receive SOW sign off from clients for CRS project development

Condition
We can get email authorization from customer to proceed with project if the SOW sign off is getting delayed.

Consequences
SOW delay will puts us into major risk on cost and associate availability. We cannot hold the associates as our CP will be hit badly.
Mitigation Plan Description: We can get email authorization from customer to proceed with project if the SOW sign off is getting delayed.

Risk Description:
Context: Docker sizing is pending
Condition: It is dependent on MuleSoft providing the sizing for the Docker - virtual box. 
Consequence: Delay in setting the docker will result in extended timeline and potential cost overrun.
Mitigation Plan Description:
MuleSoft is being engaged to provide Docker sizing for both non production and production environments.
Northwestern Mutual is working on the Docker implementation and it takes time for them to fully implement and make production ready. Currently NM is deploying the application as a standalone run time instance.

Risk Description: Identify backup resource in absence of the current resource supporting at onsite
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: inclusion of new Jrule implementation can affect the schedule estimate
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description:
Context  => This is 9 member team doing security assessment  for applications.
condition => Business identified the Cross Site Scripting as a critical vulnerability in production.
Consequence => Analyze the production vulnerabilities to identify the other alternate approach to validate Cross Site Script vulnerabilities in SAST. Planned to write a separate Custom Rule to catch these issues.
Mitigation Plan Description: If the custom rule is unable to create, an alternate plan of validating manually on the code will be implemented.

Risk Description: Dependency on external / internal API deployed on SIT
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: If any external API's not working on SIT will impact testing of the application which in turn impact delivery of the sprint

Risk Description:
This project contains Recivable  Edge browser, GICR and MBT.
Receivable Edge browser deals with payments received via check and processing automatically.Offshore Near shore team structuring team expected to change in June. This can have some impact on quality and schedule of Nov release.
Mitigation Plan Description: Extensive training to near shore members.Two months of time for transition for each on bordered member with one at offshore.

Risk Description: This is Fixed Bid Others Project. Project team is working on Migration. Primary technology is Tandem. However, dependency on client security team to provide access to Simulators to do testing after migration of the new Tandem system. Due to this, the project runs the risk of Dependency on product / Supplier management process not defined. This will in turn lead to Not Meeting on Time delivery.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Client has agreed to raise CR in case of schedule is slipped because of this dependency

Risk Description:
Context : Identity and Access Management
Condition: The contract is still not Signed off. 
Consiquences : Lack of valid contract will impact the project execution and revenue
Risk Sub-Dimension: Agreement on scope with Key Stakeholders
Mitigation Plan Description: MSA is signed. Final document sent for formal approval and signature.

Risk Description:
Context: Identity and Access management
Condition :Change in Product Stack during course of development( 1. Forge Rock 2. Cognitio)
2.Clarity of ownership on development activity between ERSS and Account Team (Bajaj has decided to go build custom app  with Java/J2ee as Technology) and Go-Live is May-2017 
Consequence : Impact on Schedule.
Mitigation Plan Description: Working with account team to leverage account team Java/J2EE resource for custom development and ERSS team providing support from IDM aspect

Risk Name: BCP testing not done as planned
Risk Description:
Context - As per the report from the BCP portal published on September, team had not completed the BCP testing as planned in the portal. The BCP testing is pending for more than 180 days. 
Condition - Due to this reason the project was categorized as Risky
Consequence - The Super Point project will not be listed in the Risky category.
Mitigation Plan Description: We are planning to do the BCP testing for the Super Point project.
Contingency Plan Description: Once in 6 months, we plan to do the BCP testing for the Super Point project

Risk Description: PeopleSoft Readiness confirmation and entity mapping confirmation is required from business.
Mitigation Plan Description: We had identified the mapping specification for PeopleSoft Readiness and provided flat text file to business for testing it.
Contingency Plan Description: If the testing is successful for EMEA PeopleSoft with no VAT flat file, then we can confirm the mapping specification.

Risk Description: Unable to use migration server simultaneously
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Increase the resource user count for accessing server
Contingency Plan Description: Increase the resource user count for accessing server

Risk Description: The team tracks the defects in JIRA for SIT/UAT Environments. In SIT, there were 619 defects identified during the time of audit. In which 602 were in closed status, 8-Opened, 5-Re-opened and 4-Fixed. Due to time constraint and last minute requirements from the Client, the team couldn’t able to complete code review and that has caused huge number of defects in SIT. Root cause Analysis / defect prevention document was not prepared by the team and couldn’t able to verify the same for the SIT defects .  The Team should perform the RCA in order to avoid the recurrence of the same type of defects which will be leaked to the subsequent stages
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Description: There is no participation from the offshore in backlog grooming, Sprint Planning, story point estimation, Demo and retrospection meeting since these meetings happen during the late night hours of offshore timing. Onsite resource participates in these meetings with the client and the same is communicated to the offshore. **RISK**: Without offshores participation in the above agile ceremonies, there is a potential risk of not understanding the business and functional requirements completely which could impact the product quality and any impediments/challenges faced by the offshore team will not be clearly understood by the Product owners and scrum masters which could impact the sprint velocity
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Risk Name: SOW Sign off delayed from the customer
Risk Description: The agreed SOW of 2016 had expired as on 31-Dec-2016.  For 2017, SOW for this project till March'17 is yet to get signed off from the client.  Absence of signed-off SOW may lead to ‘Legal/Contractual issues.
Mitigation Plan Description: Present the details of the effort spent and details pertaining to the new changes and also investments made by Cognizant to the CR /SOW approved.
Contingency Plan Description: Present the details of the effort spent and details pertaining to the new changes and also investments made by Cognizant to the CR /SOW approved.

Risk Description: Inadequate Unit test case/results
Mitigation Plan Description: We are logging test cases for each requirement and saved in server
Contingency Plan Description: We are logging test cases for each requirement and saved in server

Risk Description: Inadequate effort estimation
Mitigation Plan Description: Function point estimation is planned to follow in future requirments
Contingency Plan Description: Function point estimation is planned to follow in future requirments

Risk Description: Negative Customer Profitability
Mitigation Plan Description: --None--

Account Name: The Prudential Insurance Co. of America
Risk Description:
Context: Estimation is incorrectly computed as newly developed components are not factored in CP Model.
Consequence: Effort Variance, Rework and schedule deviation.
Mitigation Plan Description: Use the existing estimation template  and estimate for the missed components approximately and add the complexity point to the estimates. Enhance the CP sheet to factor the newly c developed components.

Condition: The new resources lack application knowledge.
Consequence: Tasks will take longer to be completed compared to experienced team members.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Resource Skill Level; Gap Assessment and Skill Enhancement
Mitigation Plan Description: We have added experienced developers and a senior manager from the committed capacity team in order to aid in the knowledge transition to the new team members.
Contingency Plan Description: We have added experienced developers and a senior manager from the committed capacity team in order to aid in the knowledge transition to the new team members.

Risk Description: Intensive time schedule of delivery
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: We already arrange locate more resource to complete the task on time

Risk Description:
Context: This is a ACE S6R maintenance project with 5 offshore developers and 1 BA at onsite, 1 developer for Claims system and 4 developers for S6R/Biz-ACE/My-Ace systems.
Condition: We only have 4 offshore developers since resource resignation.
Consequence: If resource reciuitment updates are not shared by 1st Jun there is overall Schedule delay.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Human Resources - Availability of Capacity or Capability

Risk Description: Scope for PCE 17.1 has not been finalized.  Tasks such as UI Harmonization has not been baseline.
Mitigation Plan Description: Discuss with Credit Suisse and finalize the scope
Contingency Plan Description: Scope is more than available capacity, items will be pushed to next release.

Risk Description:
Team works on the client machine with VDI connectivity provided by the customer.
VDI connection to be continuously availability .
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: RDP request is placed and is provided by the customer as a work around solution
Contingency Plan Description: We raise request with ATOS and IT support team and get the RDP access.

Risk Description: Availability of all Main systems & connectivity to in-scope sub Systems. ie. Annuity Information Management System(AIMS), Policy Owner system(POS), MyNumberSystem (MNS), Maturity Payment System(MPS).
Mitigation Plan Description: Customer has started analysis as well providing Provide Access to Each of the subsystems in scope based on the priority / dependency on the changes to be incorporated.

Risk Description: Availability of infrastructure(Thin client Access, VDI Access, DB tools(Informatica, SQL server client, Oracle Client), Application development tools(Visual studio 2005, Microsoft Visual studio for VB 6.0, TFS connectivity)
Mitigation Plan Description: Facilitation by MetLife team to ensure the availability of infrastructure, DB tools and testing tool licenses
Contingency Plan Description: Re-Planning , moving the start time for the development activity for the systems for which access is not available or processed.

Risk Name: Non-Participation of MLJ SME in POS meet
Risk Description: No participation of subsystem/POS SME  will cause delay in overall schedule
Risk Sub-Dimension: Agreement on scope with Key Stakeholders
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant BA's will finalize the requirements and have frequent discussion with MLJ SME's when needed
Contingency Plan Description: Module level concurrence with the MLJ SME's are planned to avoid any understanding gap

Risk Description: Functional requirements relevant to the Policy Owner System (POS) , Annuity Information Management System(AIMS), My Number System (MNS) should be mapped with the business requirement of sending the information of policy change details to the local tax office which is the final objective.
Mitigation Plan Description: MetLife to provide  a dedicated SME to work along with Cognizant team to  identify the GAPs on existing documentations & requirements.  Cognizant expects prompt response from SME to agree & confirm the GAP & resolution approach

Risk Description: Missing function due to different design perceptions & risk in delay of schedule due to additional functions.
Mitigation Plan Description: Involve Architects and Senior designers to analyze design  at the beginning of the Development phase and timely agreement and  sign off from MetLife Japan architects

Risk Description: Efficient testing may not be possible due to insufficient test scenarios test data
Mitigation Plan Description:
Reviews at every stage of project to ensure  defects are identified at early stages of the program
Involve Quality team from design phase to plan the review and testing phase effectively
Leveraging the domain experts to mock/create the necessary test data during development
MetLife to make test data available in integration and QA regions ahead of the integration and QA testing cycles(NOT to be replicated at offshore)

Risk Description: Delay in integration testing due to co-ordination among different vendors (e.g.  Upstream / down stream application ) in charge of developing different parts
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description:
Pre-defined schedule and aligning with priority of application changes and communication  specific vendor on the progress and made during each of the phases.
Project plan to have dependencies built and escalation mechanism to be set up to tackle the delays.

Risk Description: No existing DS1 document for the systems in scope.
Risk Sub-Dimension: Dependencies with Customer / 3rd Party / Internal Teams
Mitigation Plan Description: Cognizant only give DS1 documents only for its changes.
